00121 /* Setstripe and migrate share mostly the same parameters */
00122 #define SSM_CMD_COMMON(cmd) \
00123         "usage: "cmd" [--stripe-count|-c <stripe_count>]\n"             \
00124         "                 [--stripe-index|-i <start_ost_idx>]\n"        \
00125         "                 [--stripe-size|-S <stripe_size>]\n"           \
00126         "                 [--pool|-p <pool_name>]\n"                    \
00127         "                 [--ost-list|-o <ost_indices>]\n"
00128 
00129 #define SSM_HELP_COMMON \
00130         "\tstripe_size:  Number of bytes on each OST (0 filesystem default)\n" \
00131         "\t              Can be specified with k, m or g (in KB, MB and GB\n" \
00132         "\t              respectively)\n"                               \
00133         "\tstart_ost_idx: OST index of first stripe (-1 default)\n"     \
00134         "\tstripe_count: Number of OSTs to stripe over (0 default, -1 all)\n" \
00135         "\tpool_name:    Name of OST pool to use (default none)\n"      \
00136         "\tost_indices:  List of OST indices, can be repeated multiple times\n"\
00137         "\t              Indices be specified in a format of:\n"        \
00138         "\t                -o <ost_1>,<ost_i>-<ost_j>,<ost_n>\n"        \
00139         "\t              Or:\n"                                         \
00140         "\t                -o <ost_1> -o <ost_i>-<ost_j> -o <ost_n>\n"  \
00141         "\t              If --pool is set with --ost-list, then the OSTs\n" \
00142         "\t              must be the members of the pool."
00143 
00144 #define SETSTRIPE_USAGE                                         \
00145         SSM_CMD_COMMON("setstripe")                             \
00146         "                 <directory|filename>\n"               \
00147         SSM_HELP_COMMON
00148 
00149 #define MIGRATE_USAGE                                                   \
00150         SSM_CMD_COMMON("migrate  ")                                     \
00151         "                 [--block|-b]\n"                               \
00152         "                 [--non-block|-n]\n"                           \
00153         "                 <filename>\n"                                 \
00154         SSM_HELP_COMMON                                                 \
00155         "\n"                                                            \
00156         "\tblock:        Block file access during data migration (default)\n" \
00157         "\tnon-block:    Abort migrations if concurrent access is detected\n" \
00158 
00159 static const char       *progname;
00160 static bool              file_lease_supported = true;

00264          "                [--inode-softlimit <inode-softlimit>]\n"
00265          "                [--inode-hardlimit <inode-hardlimit>] <filesystem>\n"
00266          "       setquota [-t] <-u|--user|-g|--group>\n"
00267          "                [--block-grace <block-grace>]\n"
00268          "                [--inode-grace <inode-grace>] <filesystem>\n"
00269          "       -b can be used instead of --block-softlimit/--block-grace\n"
00270          "       -B can be used instead of --block-hardlimit\n"
00271          "       -i can be used instead of --inode-softlimit/--inode-grace\n"
00272          "       -I can be used instead of --inode-hardlimit\n\n"
00273          "Note: The total quota space will be split into many qunits and\n"
00274          "      balanced over all server targets, the minimal qunit size is\n"
00275          "      1M bytes for block space and 1K inodes for inode space.\n\n"
00276          "      Quota space rebalancing process will stop when this mininum\n"
00277          "      value is reached. As a result, quota exceeded can be returned\n"
00278          "      while many targets still have 1MB or 1K inodes of spare\n"
00279          "      quota space."},

00401 
00402 
00403 #define MIGRATION_NONBLOCK      1
00404 
00418 static int check_lease(int fd, bool *lease_broken, bool group_locked,
00419                        const char *path)
00420 {
00421         int rc;
00422 
00423         if (!file_lease_supported)
00424                 return 0;
00425 
00426         rc = llapi_lease_check(fd);
00427         if (rc > 0)
00428                 return 0; /* llapi_check_lease returns > 0 on success. */
00429 
00430         if (!group_locked) {
00431                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot migrate '%s': file busy\n",
00432                         progname, path);
00433                 rc = rc ? rc : -EAGAIN;
00434         } else {
00435                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: external attempt to access file '%s' "
00436                         "blocked until migration ends.\n", progname, path);
00437                 rc = 0;
00438         }
00439         *lease_broken = true;
00440         return rc;
00441 }
00442 
00443 static int migrate_copy_data(int fd_src, int fd_dst, size_t buf_size,
00444                              bool group_locked, const char *fname)
00445 {
00446         void    *buf = NULL;
00447         ssize_t  rsize = -1;
00448         ssize_t  wsize = 0;
00449         size_t   rpos = 0;
00450         size_t   wpos = 0;
00451         off_t    bufoff = 0;
00452         int      rc;
00453         bool     lease_broken = false;
00454 
00455         /* Use a page-aligned buffer for direct I/O */
00456         rc = posix_memalign(&buf, getpagesize(), buf_size);
00457         if (rc != 0)
00458                 return -rc;
00459 
00460         while (1) {
00461                 /* read new data only if we have written all
00462                  * previously read data */
00463                 if (wpos == rpos) {
00464                         if (!lease_broken) {
00465                                 rc = check_lease(fd_src, &lease_broken,
00466                                                  group_locked, fname);
00467                                 if (rc < 0)
00468                                         goto out;
00469                         }
00470                         rsize = read(fd_src, buf, buf_size);
00471                         if (rsize < 0) {
00472                                 rc = -errno;
00473                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: read failed: %s\n",
00474                                         progname, fname, strerror(-rc));
00475                                 goto out;
00476                         }
00477                         rpos += rsize;
00478                         bufoff = 0;
00479                 }
00480                 /* eof ? */
00481                 if (rsize == 0)
00482                         break;
00483 
00484                 wsize = write(fd_dst, buf + bufoff, rpos - wpos);
00485                 if (wsize < 0) {
00486                         rc = -errno;
00487                         fprintf(stderr,
00488                                 "%s: %s: write failed on volatile: %s\n",
00489                                 progname, fname, strerror(-rc));
00490                         goto out;
00491                 }
00492                 wpos += wsize;
00493                 bufoff += wsize;
00494         }
00495 
00496         rc = fsync(fd_dst);
00497         if (rc < 0) {
00498                 rc = -errno;
00499                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: fsync failed: %s\n",
00500                         progname, fname, strerror(-rc));
00501         }
00502 
00503 out:
00504         free(buf);
00505         return rc;
00506 }
00507 
00508 static int migrate_copy_timestamps(int fdv, const struct stat *st)
00509 {
00510         struct timeval  tv[2] = {
00511                 {.tv_sec = st->st_atime},
00512                 {.tv_sec = st->st_mtime}
00513         };
00514 
00515         return futimes(fdv, tv);
00516 }
00517 
00518 static int migrate_block(int fd, int fdv, const struct stat *st,
00519                          size_t buf_size, const char *name)
00520 {
00521         __u64   dv1;
00522         int     gid;
00523         int     rc;
00524         int     rc2;
00525 
00526         rc = llapi_get_data_version(fd, &dv1, LL_DV_RD_FLUSH);
00527         if (rc < 0) {
00528                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot get dataversion: %s\n",
00529                         progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00530                 return rc;
00531         }
00532 
00533         do
00534                 gid = random();
00535         while (gid == 0);
00536 
00537         /* The grouplock blocks all concurrent accesses to the file.
00538          * It has to be taken after llapi_get_data_version as it would
00539          * block it too. */
00540         rc = llapi_group_lock(fd, gid);
00541         if (rc < 0) {
00542                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot get group lock: %s\n",
00543                         progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00544                 return rc;
00545         }
00546 
00547         rc = migrate_copy_data(fd, fdv, buf_size, true, name);
00548         if (rc < 0) {
00549                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: data copy failed\n", progname, name);
00550                 goto out_unlock;
00551         }
00552 
00553         /* Make sure we keep original atime/mtime values */
00554         rc = migrate_copy_timestamps(fdv, st);
00555         if (rc < 0) {
00556                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: timestamp copy failed\n",
00557                         progname, name);
00558                 goto out_unlock;
00559         }
00560 
00561         /* swap layouts
00562          * for a migration we need to check data version on file did
00563          * not change.
00564          *
00565          * Pass in gid=0 since we already own grouplock. */
00566         rc = llapi_fswap_layouts_grouplock(fd, fdv, dv1, 0, 0,
00567                                            SWAP_LAYOUTS_CHECK_DV1);
00568         if (rc == -EAGAIN) {
00569                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: dataversion changed during copy, "
00570                         "migration aborted\n", progname, name);
00571                 goto out_unlock;
00572         } else if (rc < 0) {
00573                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot swap layouts: %s\n", progname,
00574                         name, strerror(-rc));
00575                 goto out_unlock;
00576         }
00577 
00578 out_unlock:
00579         rc2 = llapi_group_unlock(fd, gid);
00580         if (rc2 < 0 && rc == 0) {
00581                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: putting group lock failed: %s\n",
00582                         progname, name, strerror(-rc2));
00583                 rc = rc2;
00584         }
00585 
00586         return rc;
00587 }
00588 
00589 static int migrate_nonblock(int fd, int fdv, const struct stat *st,
00590                             size_t buf_size, const char *name)
00591 {
00592         __u64   dv1;
00593         __u64   dv2;
00594         int     rc;
00595 
00596         rc = llapi_get_data_version(fd, &dv1, LL_DV_RD_FLUSH);
00597         if (rc < 0) {
00598                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot get data version: %s\n",
00599                         progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00600                 return rc;
00601         }
00602 
00603         rc = migrate_copy_data(fd, fdv, buf_size, false, name);
00604         if (rc < 0) {
00605                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: data copy failed\n", progname, name);
00606                 return rc;
00607         }
00608 
00609         rc = llapi_get_data_version(fd, &dv2, LL_DV_RD_FLUSH);
00610         if (rc != 0) {
00611                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot get data version: %s\n",
00612                         progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00613                 return rc;
00614         }
00615 
00616         if (dv1 != dv2) {
00617                 rc = -EAGAIN;
00618                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: data version changed during "
00619                                 "migration\n",
00620                         progname, name);
00621                 return rc;
00622         }
00623 
00624         /* Make sure we keep original atime/mtime values */
00625         rc = migrate_copy_timestamps(fdv, st);
00626         if (rc < 0) {
00627                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: timestamp copy failed\n",
00628                         progname, name);
00629                 return rc;
00630         }
00631 
00632         /* Atomically put lease, swap layouts and close.
00633          * for a migration we need to check data version on file did
00634          * not change. */
00635         rc = llapi_fswap_layouts(fd, fdv, 0, 0, SWAP_LAYOUTS_CLOSE);
00636         if (rc < 0) {
00637                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot swap layouts: %s\n",
00638                         progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00639                 return rc;
00640         }
00641 
00642         return 0;
00643 }
00644 
00645 static int lfs_migrate(char *name, __u64 migration_flags,
00646                        struct llapi_stripe_param *param)
00647 {
00648         int                      fd = -1;
00649         int                      fdv = -1;
00650         char                     parent[PATH_MAX];
00651         int                      mdt_index;
00652         int                      random_value;
00653         char                     volatile_file[sizeof(parent) +
00654                                                LUSTRE_VOLATILE_HDR_LEN +
00655                                                2 * sizeof(mdt_index) +
00656                                                2 * sizeof(random_value) + 4];
00657         char                    *ptr;
00658         int                      rc;
00659         struct lov_user_md      *lum = NULL;
00660         int                      lum_size;
00661         int                      buf_size;
00662         bool                     have_lease_rdlck = false;
00663         struct stat              st;
00664         struct stat              stv;
00665 
00666         /* find the right size for the IO and allocate the buffer */
00667         lum_size = lov_user_md_size(LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT, LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3);
00668         lum = malloc(lum_size);
00669         if (lum == NULL) {
00670                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00671                 goto free;
00672         }
00673 
00674         rc = llapi_file_get_stripe(name, lum);
00675         /* failure can happen for many reasons and some may be not real errors
00676          * (eg: no stripe)
00677          * in case of a real error, a later call will fail with better
00678          * error management */
00679         if (rc < 0)
00680                 buf_size = 1024 * 1024;
00681         else
00682                 buf_size = lum->lmm_stripe_size;
00683 
00684         /* open file, direct io */
00685         /* even if the file is only read, WR mode is nedeed to allow
00686          * layout swap on fd */
00687         fd = open(name, O_RDWR | O_DIRECT);
00688         if (fd == -1) {
00689                 rc = -errno;
00690                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot open: %s\n", progname, name,
00691                         strerror(-rc));
00692                 goto free;
00693         }
00694 
00695         if (file_lease_supported) {
00696                 rc = llapi_lease_get(fd, LL_LEASE_RDLCK);
00697                 if (rc == -EOPNOTSUPP) {
00698                         /* Older servers do not support file lease.
00699                          * Disable related checks. This opens race conditions
00700                          * as explained in LU-4840 */
00701                         file_lease_supported = false;
00702                 } else if (rc < 0) {
00703                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot get open lease: %s\n",
00704                                 progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00705                         goto error;
00706                 } else {
00707                         have_lease_rdlck = true;
00708                 }
00709         }
00710 
00711         /* search for file directory pathname */
00712         if (strlen(name) > sizeof(parent)-1) {
00713                 rc = -E2BIG;
00714                 goto error;
00715         }
00716         strncpy(parent, name, sizeof(parent));
00717         ptr = strrchr(parent, '/');
00718         if (ptr == NULL) {
00719                 if (getcwd(parent, sizeof(parent)) == NULL) {
00720                         rc = -errno;
00721                         goto error;
00722                 }
00723         } else {
00724                 if (ptr == parent)
00725                         strcpy(parent, "/");
00726                 else
00727                         *ptr = '\0';
00728         }
00729 
00730         rc = llapi_file_fget_mdtidx(fd, &mdt_index);
00731         if (rc < 0) {
00732                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot get MDT index: %s\n",
00733                         progname, name, strerror(-rc));
00734                 goto error;
00735         }
00736 
00737         do {
00738                 random_value = random();
00739                 rc = snprintf(volatile_file, sizeof(volatile_file),
00740                               "%s/%s:%.4X:%.4X", parent, LUSTRE_VOLATILE_HDR,
00741                               mdt_index, random_value);
00742                 if (rc >= sizeof(volatile_file)) {
00743                         rc = -E2BIG;
00744                         goto error;
00745                 }
00746 
00747                 /* create, open a volatile file, use caching (ie no directio) */
00748                 fdv = llapi_file_open_param(volatile_file,
00749                                 O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_EXCL | O_NOFOLLOW,
00750                                             S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR, param);
00751         } while (fdv == -EEXIST);
00752 
00753         if (fdv < 0) {
00754                 rc = fdv;
00755                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot create volatile file in"
00756                                 " directory: %s\n",
00757                         progname, parent, strerror(-rc));
00758                 goto error;
00759         }
00760 
00761         /* Not-owner (root?) special case.
00762          * Need to set owner/group of volatile file like original.
00763          * This will allow to pass related check during layout_swap.
00764          */
00765         rc = fstat(fd, &st);
00766         if (rc != 0) {
00767                 rc = -errno;
00768                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot stat: %s\n", progname, name,
00769                         strerror(errno));
00770                 goto error;
00771         }
00772         rc = fstat(fdv, &stv);
00773         if (rc != 0) {
00774                 rc = -errno;
00775                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot stat: %s\n", progname,
00776                         volatile_file, strerror(errno));
00777                 goto error;
00778         }
00779         if (st.st_uid != stv.st_uid || st.st_gid != stv.st_gid) {
00780                 rc = fchown(fdv, st.st_uid, st.st_gid);
00781                 if (rc != 0) {
00782                         rc = -errno;
00783                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: cannot chown: %s\n", progname,
00784                                 name, strerror(errno));
00785                         goto error;
00786                 }
00787         }
00788 
00789         if (migration_flags & MIGRATION_NONBLOCK && file_lease_supported) {
00790                 rc = migrate_nonblock(fd, fdv, &st, buf_size, name);
00791                 if (rc == 0) {
00792                         have_lease_rdlck = false;
00793                         fdv = -1; /* The volatile file is closed as we put the
00794                                    * lease in non-blocking mode. */
00795                 }
00796         } else {
00797                 /* Blocking mode (forced if servers do not support file lease).
00798                  * It is also the default mode, since we cannot distinguish
00799                  * between a broken lease and a server that does not support
00800                  * atomic swap/close (LU-6785) */
00801                 rc = migrate_block(fd, fdv, &st, buf_size, name);
00802         }
00803 
00804 error:
00805         if (have_lease_rdlck)
00806                 llapi_lease_put(fd);
00807 
00808         if (fd >= 0)
00809                 close(fd);
00810 
00811         if (fdv >= 0)
00812                 close(fdv);
00813 
00814 free:
00815         if (lum)
00816                 free(lum);
00817 
00818         return rc;
00819 }
00820 
00836 static int parse_targets(__u32 *osts, int size, int offset, char *arg)
00837 {
00838         int rc;
00839         int nr = offset;
00840         int slots = size - offset;
00841         char *ptr = NULL;
00842         bool end_of_loop;
00843 
00844         if (arg == NULL)
00845                 return -EINVAL;
00846 
00847         end_of_loop = false;
00848         while (!end_of_loop) {
00849                 int start_index;
00850                 int end_index;
00851                 int i;
00852                 char *endptr = NULL;
00853 
00854                 rc = -EINVAL;
00855 
00856                 ptr = strchrnul(arg, ',');
00857 
00858                 end_of_loop = *ptr == '\0';
00859                 *ptr = '\0';
00860 
00861                 start_index = strtol(arg, &endptr, 0);
00862                 if (endptr == arg) /* no data at all */
00863                         break;
00864                 if (*endptr != '-' && *endptr != '\0') /* has invalid data */
00865                         break;
00866                 if (start_index < 0)
00867                         break;
00868 
00869                 end_index = start_index;
00870                 if (*endptr == '-') {
00871                         end_index = strtol(endptr + 1, &endptr, 0);
00872                         if (*endptr != '\0')
00873                                 break;
00874                         if (end_index < start_index)
00875                                 break;
00876                 }
00877 
00878                 for (i = start_index; i <= end_index && slots > 0; i++) {
00879                         int j;
00880 
00881                         /* remove duplicate */
00882                         for (j = 0; j < offset; j++) {
00883                                 if (osts[j] == i)
00884                                         break;
00885                         }
00886                         if (j == offset) { /* no duplicate */
00887                                 osts[nr++] = i;
00888                                 --slots;
00889                         }
00890                 }
00891                 if (slots == 0 && i < end_index)
00892                         break;
00893 
00894                 *ptr = ',';
00895                 arg = ++ptr;
00896                 offset = nr;
00897                 rc = 0;
00898         }
00899         if (!end_of_loop && ptr != NULL)
00900                 *ptr = ',';
00901 
00902         return rc < 0 ? rc : nr;
00903 }
00904 
00905 /* functions */
00906 static int lfs_setstripe(int argc, char **argv)
00907 {
00908         struct llapi_stripe_param       *param = NULL;
00909         struct find_param                migrate_mdt_param = {
00910                 .fp_max_depth = -1,
00911                 .fp_mdt_index = -1,
00912         };
00913         char                            *fname;
00914         int                              result;
00915         int                              result2 = 0;
00916         unsigned long long               st_size;
00917         int                              st_offset, st_count;
00918         char                            *end;
00919         int                              c;
00920         int                              delete = 0;
00921         char                            *stripe_size_arg = NULL;
00922         char                            *stripe_off_arg = NULL;
00923         char                            *stripe_count_arg = NULL;
00924         char                            *pool_name_arg = NULL;
00925         char                            *mdt_idx_arg = NULL;
00926         unsigned long long               size_units = 1;
00927         bool                             migrate_mode = false;
00928         bool                             migration_block = false;
00929         __u64                            migration_flags = 0;
00930         __u32                            osts[LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT] = { 0 };
00931         int                              nr_osts = 0;
00932 
00933         struct option            long_opts[] = {
00934                 /* --block is only valid in migrate mode */
00935                 {"block",        no_argument,       0, 'b'},
00936 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
00937                 /* This formerly implied "stripe-count", but was explicitly
00938                  * made "stripe-count" for consistency with other options,
00939                  * and to separate it from "mdt-count" when DNE arrives. */
00940                 {"count",        required_argument, 0, 'c'},
00941 #endif
00942                 {"stripe-count", required_argument, 0, 'c'},
00943                 {"stripe_count", required_argument, 0, 'c'},
00944                 {"delete",       no_argument,       0, 'd'},
00945 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
00946                 /* This formerly implied "stripe-index", but was explicitly
00947                  * made "stripe-index" for consistency with other options,
00948                  * and to separate it from "mdt-index" when DNE arrives. */
00949                 {"index",        required_argument, 0, 'i'},
00950 #endif
00951                 {"stripe-index", required_argument, 0, 'i'},
00952                 {"stripe_index", required_argument, 0, 'i'},
00953                 {"mdt-index",    required_argument, 0, 'm'},
00954                 {"mdt_index",    required_argument, 0, 'm'},
00955                 /* --non-block is only valid in migrate mode */
00956                 {"non-block",    no_argument,       0, 'n'},
00957                 {"ost-list",     required_argument, 0, 'o'},
00958                 {"ost_list",     required_argument, 0, 'o'},
00959                 {"pool",         required_argument, 0, 'p'},
00960 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
00961                 /* This formerly implied "--stripe-size", but was confusing
00962                  * with "lfs find --size|-s", which means "file size", so use
00963                  * the consistent "--stripe-size|-S" for all commands. */
00964                 {"size",         required_argument, 0, 's'},
00965 #endif
00966                 {"stripe-size",  required_argument, 0, 'S'},
00967                 {"stripe_size",  required_argument, 0, 'S'},
00968                 /* --verbose is only valid in migrate mode */
00969                 {"verbose",      no_argument,       0, 'v'},
00970                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
00971         };
00972 
00973         st_size = 0;
00974         st_offset = -1;
00975         st_count = 0;
00976 
00977         if (strcmp(argv[0], "migrate") == 0)
00978                 migrate_mode = true;
00979 
00980         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "bc:di:m:no:p:s:S:v",
00981                                 long_opts, NULL)) >= 0) {
00982                 switch (c) {
00983                 case 0:
00984                         /* Long options. */
00985                         break;
00986                 case 'b':
00987                         if (!migrate_mode) {
00988                                 fprintf(stderr, "--block is valid only for"
00989                                                 " migrate mode\n");
00990                                 return CMD_HELP;
00991                         }
00992                         migration_block = true;
00993                         break;
00994                 case 'c':
00995 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 6, 53, 0)
00996                         if (strcmp(argv[optind - 1], "--count") == 0)
00997                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--count' deprecated"
00998                                         ", use '--stripe-count' instead\n");
00999 #endif
01000                         stripe_count_arg = optarg;
01001                         break;
01002                 case 'd':
01003                         /* delete the default striping pattern */
01004                         delete = 1;
01005                         break;
01006                 case 'o':
01007                         nr_osts = parse_targets(osts,
01008                                                 sizeof(osts) / sizeof(__u32),
01009                                                 nr_osts, optarg);
01010                         if (nr_osts < 0) {
01011                                 fprintf(stderr,
01012                                         "error: %s: bad OST indices '%s'\n",
01013                                         argv[0], optarg);
01014                                 return CMD_HELP;
01015                         }
01016 
01017                         if (st_offset == -1) /* first in the command line */
01018                                 st_offset = osts[0];
01019                         break;
01020                 case 'i':
01021 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 6, 53, 0)
01022                         if (strcmp(argv[optind - 1], "--index") == 0)
01023                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--index' deprecated"
01024                                         ", use '--stripe-index' instead\n");
01025 #endif
01026                         stripe_off_arg = optarg;
01027                         break;
01028                 case 'm':
01029                         if (!migrate_mode) {
01030                                 fprintf(stderr, "--mdt-index is valid only for"
01031                                                 " migrate mode\n");
01032                                 return CMD_HELP;
01033                         }
01034                         mdt_idx_arg = optarg;
01035                         break;
01036                 case 'n':
01037                         if (!migrate_mode) {
01038                                 fprintf(stderr, "--non-block is valid only for"
01039                                                 " migrate mode\n");
01040                                 return CMD_HELP;
01041                         }
01042                         migration_flags |= MIGRATION_NONBLOCK;
01043                         break;
01044 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01045                 case 's':
01046 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 6, 53, 0)
01047                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--size|-s' deprecated, "
01048                                 "use '--stripe-size|-S' instead\n");
01049 #endif
01050 #endif /* LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0) */
01051                 case 'S':
01052                         stripe_size_arg = optarg;
01053                         break;
01054                 case 'p':
01055                         pool_name_arg = optarg;
01056                         break;
01057                 case 'v':
01058                         if (!migrate_mode) {
01059                                 fprintf(stderr, "--verbose is valid only for"
01060                                                 " migrate mode\n");
01061                                 return CMD_HELP;
01062                         }
01063                         migrate_mdt_param.fp_verbose = VERBOSE_DETAIL;
01064                         break;
01065                 default:
01066                         return CMD_HELP;
01067                 }
01068         }
01069 
01070         fname = argv[optind];
01071 
01072         if (delete &&
01073             (stripe_size_arg != NULL || stripe_off_arg != NULL ||
01074              stripe_count_arg != NULL || pool_name_arg != NULL)) {
01075                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot specify -d with "
01076                         "-s, -c, -o, or -p options\n",
01077                         argv[0]);
01078                 return CMD_HELP;
01079         }
01080 
01081         if (optind == argc) {
01082                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: missing filename|dirname\n",
01083                         argv[0]);
01084                 return CMD_HELP;
01085         }
01086 
01087         if (mdt_idx_arg != NULL && optind > 3) {
01088                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot specify -m with other "
01089                         "options\n", argv[0]);
01090                 return CMD_HELP;
01091         }
01092 
01093         if ((migration_flags & MIGRATION_NONBLOCK) && migration_block) {
01094                 fprintf(stderr,
01095                         "error: %s: cannot specify --non-block and --block\n",
01096                         argv[0]);
01097                 return CMD_HELP;
01098         }
01099 
01100         if (pool_name_arg != NULL) {
01101                 char    *ptr;
01102                 int     rc;
01103 
01104                 ptr = strchr(pool_name_arg, '.');
01105                 if (ptr == NULL) {
01106                         ptr = pool_name_arg;
01107                 } else {
01108                         if ((ptr - pool_name_arg) == 0) {
01109                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: fsname is empty "
01110                                         "in pool name '%s'\n",
01111                                         argv[0], pool_name_arg);
01112                                 return CMD_HELP;
01113                         }
01114 
01115                         ++ptr;
01116                 }
01117 
01118                 rc = lustre_is_poolname_valid(ptr, 1, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
01119                 if (rc == -1) {
01120                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: poolname '%s' is "
01121                                 "empty\n",
01122                                 argv[0], pool_name_arg);
01123                         return CMD_HELP;
01124                 } else if (rc == -2) {
01125                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: pool name '%s' is too long "
01126                                 "(max is %d characters)\n",
01127                                 argv[0], pool_name_arg, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
01128                         return CMD_HELP;
01129                 } else if (rc > 0) {
01130                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: char '%c' not allowed in "
01131                                 "pool name '%s'\n",
01132                                 argv[0], rc, pool_name_arg);
01133                         return CMD_HELP;
01134                 }
01135         }
01136 
01137         /* get the stripe size */
01138         if (stripe_size_arg != NULL) {
01139                 result = llapi_parse_size(stripe_size_arg, &st_size,
01140                                           &size_units, 0);
01141                 if (result) {
01142                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe size '%s'\n",
01143                                 argv[0], stripe_size_arg);
01144                         return CMD_HELP;
01145                 }
01146         }
01147         /* get the stripe offset */
01148         if (stripe_off_arg != NULL) {
01149                 st_offset = strtol(stripe_off_arg, &end, 0);
01150                 if (*end != '\0') {
01151                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe offset '%s'\n",
01152                                 argv[0], stripe_off_arg);
01153                         return CMD_HELP;
01154                 }
01155         }
01156         /* get the stripe count */
01157         if (stripe_count_arg != NULL) {
01158                 st_count = strtoul(stripe_count_arg, &end, 0);
01159                 if (*end != '\0') {
01160                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe count '%s'\n",
01161                                 argv[0], stripe_count_arg);
01162                         return CMD_HELP;
01163                 }
01164         }
01165 
01166         if (mdt_idx_arg != NULL) {
01167                 /* initialize migrate mdt parameters */
01168                 migrate_mdt_param.fp_mdt_index = strtoul(mdt_idx_arg, &end, 0);
01169                 if (*end != '\0') {
01170                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad MDT index '%s'\n",
01171                                 argv[0], mdt_idx_arg);
01172                         return CMD_HELP;
01173                 }
01174                 migrate_mdt_param.fp_migrate = 1;
01175         } else {
01176                 /* initialize stripe parameters */
01177                 param = calloc(1, offsetof(typeof(*param), lsp_osts[nr_osts]));
01178                 if (param == NULL) {
01179                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: run out of memory\n",
01180                                 argv[0]);
01181                         return CMD_HELP;
01182                 }
01183 
01184                 param->lsp_stripe_size = st_size;
01185                 param->lsp_stripe_offset = st_offset;
01186                 param->lsp_stripe_count = st_count;
01187                 param->lsp_stripe_pattern = 0;
01188                 param->lsp_pool = pool_name_arg;
01189                 param->lsp_is_specific = false;
01190                 if (nr_osts > 0) {
01191                         if (st_count > 0 && nr_osts != st_count) {
01192                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: stripe count '%d' "
01193                                         "doesn't match the number of OSTs: %d\n"
01194                                         , argv[0], st_count, nr_osts);
01195                                 free(param);
01196                                 return CMD_HELP;
01197                         }
01198 
01199                         param->lsp_is_specific = true;
01200                         param->lsp_stripe_count = nr_osts;
01201                         memcpy(param->lsp_osts, osts, sizeof(*osts) * nr_osts);
01202                 }
01203         }
01204 
01205         for (fname = argv[optind]; fname != NULL; fname = argv[++optind]) {
01206                 if (!migrate_mode) {
01207                         result = llapi_file_open_param(fname,
01208                                                        O_CREAT | O_WRONLY,
01209                                                        0644, param);
01210                         if (result >= 0) {
01211                                 close(result);
01212                                 result = 0;
01213                         }
01214                 } else if (mdt_idx_arg != NULL) {
01215                         result = llapi_migrate_mdt(fname, &migrate_mdt_param);
01216                 } else {
01217                         result = lfs_migrate(fname, migration_flags, param);
01218                 }
01219                 if (result) {
01220                         /* Save the first error encountered. */
01221                         if (result2 == 0)
01222                                 result2 = result;
01223                         fprintf(stderr,
01224                                 "error: %s: %s file '%s' failed\n",
01225                                 argv[0], migrate_mode ? "migrate" : "create",
01226                                 fname);
01227                         continue;
01228                 }
01229         }
01230 
01231         free(param);
01232         return result2;
01233 }
01234 
01235 static int lfs_poollist(int argc, char **argv)
01236 {
01237         if (argc != 2)
01238                 return CMD_HELP;
01239 
01240         return llapi_poollist(argv[1]);
01241 }
01242 
01243 static int set_time(time_t *time, time_t *set, char *str)
01244 {
01245         time_t t;
01246         int res = 0;
01247 
01248         if (str[0] == '+')
01249                 res = 1;
01250         else if (str[0] == '-')
01251                 res = -1;
01252 
01253         if (res)
01254                 str++;
01255 
01256         t = strtol(str, NULL, 0);
01257         if (*time < t * 24 * 60 * 60) {
01258                 if (res)
01259                         str--;
01260                 fprintf(stderr, "Wrong time '%s' is specified.\n", str);
01261                 return INT_MAX;
01262         }
01263 
01264         *set = *time - t * 24 * 60 * 60;
01265         return res;
01266 }
01267 
01268 #define USER 0
01269 #define GROUP 1
01270 
01271 static int name2id(unsigned int *id, char *name, int type)
01272 {
01273         if (type == USER) {
01274                 struct passwd *entry;
01275 
01276                 if (!(entry = getpwnam(name))) {
01277                         if (!errno)
01278                                 errno = ENOENT;
01279                         return -1;
01280                 }
01281 
01282                 *id = entry->pw_uid;
01283         } else {
01284                 struct group *entry;
01285 
01286                 if (!(entry = getgrnam(name))) {
01287                         if (!errno)
01288                                 errno = ENOENT;
01289                         return -1;
01290                 }
01291 
01292                 *id = entry->gr_gid;
01293         }
01294 
01295         return 0;
01296 }
01297 
01298 static int id2name(char **name, unsigned int id, int type)
01299 {
01300         if (type == USER) {
01301                 struct passwd *entry;
01302 
01303                 if (!(entry = getpwuid(id))) {
01304                         if (!errno)
01305                                 errno = ENOENT;
01306                         return -1;
01307                 }
01308 
01309                 *name = entry->pw_name;
01310         } else {
01311                 struct group *entry;
01312 
01313                 if (!(entry = getgrgid(id))) {
01314                         if (!errno)
01315                                 errno = ENOENT;
01316                         return -1;
01317                 }
01318 
01319                 *name = entry->gr_name;
01320         }
01321 
01322         return 0;
01323 }
01324 
01325 static int name2layout(__u32 *layout, char *name)
01326 {
01327         char *ptr, *lyt;
01328 
01329         *layout = 0;
01330         for (ptr = name; ; ptr = NULL) {
01331                 lyt = strtok(ptr, ",");
01332                 if (lyt == NULL)
01333                         break;
01334                 if (strcmp(lyt, "released") == 0)
01335                         *layout |= LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED;
01336                 else if (strcmp(lyt, "raid0") == 0)
01337                         *layout |= LOV_PATTERN_RAID0;
01338                 else
01339                         return -1;
01340         }
01341         return 0;
01342 }
01343 
01344 #define FIND_POOL_OPT 3
01345 static int lfs_find(int argc, char **argv)
01346 {
01347         int c, rc;
01348         int ret = 0;
01349         time_t t;
01350         struct find_param param = {
01351                 .fp_max_depth = -1,
01352                 .fp_quiet = 1,
01353         };
01354         struct option long_opts[] = {
01355                 {"atime",        required_argument, 0, 'A'},
01356                 {"stripe-count", required_argument, 0, 'c'},
01357                 {"stripe_count", required_argument, 0, 'c'},
01358                 {"ctime",        required_argument, 0, 'C'},
01359                 {"maxdepth",     required_argument, 0, 'D'},
01360                 {"gid",          required_argument, 0, 'g'},
01361                 {"group",        required_argument, 0, 'G'},
01362                 {"stripe-index", required_argument, 0, 'i'},
01363                 {"stripe_index", required_argument, 0, 'i'},
01364                 {"layout",       required_argument, 0, 'L'},
01365                 {"mdt",          required_argument, 0, 'm'},
01366                 {"mtime",        required_argument, 0, 'M'},
01367                 {"name",         required_argument, 0, 'n'},
01368      /* reserve {"or",           no_argument,     , 0, 'o'}, to match find(1) */
01369                 {"obd",          required_argument, 0, 'O'},
01370                 {"ost",          required_argument, 0, 'O'},
01371                 /* no short option for pool, p/P already used */
01372                 {"pool",         required_argument, 0, FIND_POOL_OPT},
01373                 {"print0",       no_argument,       0, 'p'},
01374                 {"print",        no_argument,       0, 'P'},
01375                 {"size",         required_argument, 0, 's'},
01376                 {"stripe-size",  required_argument, 0, 'S'},
01377                 {"stripe_size",  required_argument, 0, 'S'},
01378                 {"type",         required_argument, 0, 't'},
01379                 {"uid",          required_argument, 0, 'u'},
01380                 {"user",         required_argument, 0, 'U'},
01381                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
01382         };
01383         int pathstart = -1;
01384         int pathend = -1;
01385         int neg_opt = 0;
01386         time_t *xtime;
01387         int *xsign;
01388         int isoption;
01389         char *endptr;
01390 
01391         time(&t);
01392 
01393         /* when getopt_long_only() hits '!' it returns 1, puts "!" in optarg */
01394         while ((c = getopt_long_only(argc, argv,
01395                                      "-A:c:C:D:g:G:i:L:m:M:n:O:Ppqrs:S:t:u:U:v",
01396                                      long_opts, NULL)) >= 0) {
01397                 xtime = NULL;
01398                 xsign = NULL;
01399                 if (neg_opt)
01400                         --neg_opt;
01401                 /* '!' is part of option */
01402                 /* when getopt_long_only() finds a string which is not
01403                  * an option nor a known option argument it returns 1
01404                  * in that case if we already have found pathstart and pathend
01405                  * (i.e. we have the list of pathnames),
01406                  * the only supported value is "!"
01407                  */
01408                 isoption = (c != 1) || (strcmp(optarg, "!") == 0);
01409                 if (!isoption && pathend != -1) {
01410                         fprintf(stderr, "err: %s: filename|dirname must either "
01411                                         "precede options or follow options\n",
01412                                         argv[0]);
01413                         ret = CMD_HELP;
01414                         goto err;
01415                 }
01416                 if (!isoption && pathstart == -1)
01417                         pathstart = optind - 1;
01418                 if (isoption && pathstart != -1 && pathend == -1)
01419                         pathend = optind - 2;
01420                 switch (c) {
01421                 case 0:
01422                         /* Long options. */
01423                         break;
01424                 case 1:
01425                         /* unknown; opt is "!" or path component,
01426                          * checking done above.
01427                          */
01428                         if (strcmp(optarg, "!") == 0)
01429                                 neg_opt = 2;
01430                         break;
01431                 case 'A':
01432                         xtime = &param.fp_atime;
01433                         xsign = &param.fp_asign;
01434                         param.fp_exclude_atime = !!neg_opt;
01435                         /* no break, this falls through to 'C' for ctime */
01436                 case 'C':
01437                         if (c == 'C') {
01438                                 xtime = &param.fp_ctime;
01439                                 xsign = &param.fp_csign;
01440                                 param.fp_exclude_ctime = !!neg_opt;
01441                         }
01442                         /* no break, this falls through to 'M' for mtime */
01443                 case 'M':
01444                         if (c == 'M') {
01445                                 xtime = &param.fp_mtime;
01446                                 xsign = &param.fp_msign;
01447                                 param.fp_exclude_mtime = !!neg_opt;
01448                         }
01449                         rc = set_time(&t, xtime, optarg);
01450                         if (rc == INT_MAX) {
01451                                 ret = -1;
01452                                 goto err;
01453                         }
01454                         if (rc)
01455                                 *xsign = rc;
01456                         break;
01457                 case 'c':
01458                         if (optarg[0] == '+') {
01459                                 param.fp_stripe_count_sign = -1;
01460                                 optarg++;
01461                         } else if (optarg[0] == '-') {
01462                                 param.fp_stripe_count_sign =  1;
01463                                 optarg++;
01464                         }
01465 
01466                         param.fp_stripe_count = strtoul(optarg, &endptr, 0);
01467                         if (*endptr != '\0') {
01468                                 fprintf(stderr,"error: bad stripe_count '%s'\n",
01469                                         optarg);
01470                                 ret = -1;
01471                                 goto err;
01472                         }
01473                         param.fp_check_stripe_count = 1;
01474                         param.fp_exclude_stripe_count = !!neg_opt;
01475                         break;
01476                 case 'D':
01477                         param.fp_max_depth = strtol(optarg, 0, 0);
01478                         break;
01479                 case 'g':
01480                 case 'G':
01481                         rc = name2id(&param.fp_gid, optarg, GROUP);
01482                         if (rc) {
01483                                 param.fp_gid = strtoul(optarg, &endptr, 10);
01484                                 if (*endptr != '\0') {
01485                                         fprintf(stderr, "Group/GID: %s cannot "
01486                                                 "be found.\n", optarg);
01487                                         ret = -1;
01488                                         goto err;
01489                                 }
01490                         }
01491                         param.fp_exclude_gid = !!neg_opt;
01492                         param.fp_check_gid = 1;
01493                         break;
01494                 case 'L':
01495                         ret = name2layout(&param.fp_layout, optarg);
01496                         if (ret)
01497                                 goto err;
01498                         param.fp_exclude_layout = !!neg_opt;
01499                         param.fp_check_layout = 1;
01500                         break;
01501                 case 'u':
01502                 case 'U':
01503                         rc = name2id(&param.fp_uid, optarg, USER);
01504                         if (rc) {
01505                                 param.fp_uid = strtoul(optarg, &endptr, 10);
01506                                 if (*endptr != '\0') {
01507                                         fprintf(stderr, "User/UID: %s cannot "
01508                                                 "be found.\n", optarg);
01509                                         ret = -1;
01510                                         goto err;
01511                                 }
01512                         }
01513                         param.fp_exclude_uid = !!neg_opt;
01514                         param.fp_check_uid = 1;
01515                         break;
01516                 case FIND_POOL_OPT:
01517                         if (strlen(optarg) > LOV_MAXPOOLNAME) {
01518                                 fprintf(stderr,
01519                                         "Pool name %s is too long"
01520                                         " (max is %d)\n", optarg,
01521                                         LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
01522                                 ret = -1;
01523                                 goto err;
01524                         }
01525                         /* we do check for empty pool because empty pool
01526                          * is used to find V1 lov attributes */
01527                         strncpy(param.fp_poolname, optarg, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
01528                         param.fp_poolname[LOV_MAXPOOLNAME] = '\0';
01529                         param.fp_exclude_pool = !!neg_opt;
01530                         param.fp_check_pool = 1;
01531                         break;
01532                 case 'n':
01533                         param.fp_pattern = (char *)optarg;
01534                         param.fp_exclude_pattern = !!neg_opt;
01535                         break;
01536                 case 'm':
01537                 case 'i':
01538                 case 'O': {
01539                         char *buf, *token, *next, *p;
01540                         int len = 1;
01541                         void *tmp;
01542 
01543                         buf = strdup(optarg);
01544                         if (buf == NULL) {
01545                                 ret = -ENOMEM;
01546                                 goto err;
01547                         }
01548 
01549                         param.fp_exclude_obd = !!neg_opt;
01550 
01551                         token = buf;
01552                         while (token && *token) {
01553                                 token = strchr(token, ',');
01554                                 if (token) {
01555                                         len++;
01556                                         token++;
01557                                 }
01558                         }
01559                         if (c == 'm') {
01560                                 param.fp_exclude_mdt = !!neg_opt;
01561                                 param.fp_num_alloc_mdts += len;
01562                                 tmp = realloc(param.fp_mdt_uuid,
01563                                               param.fp_num_alloc_mdts *
01564                                               sizeof(*param.fp_mdt_uuid));
01565                                 if (tmp == NULL) {
01566                                         ret = -ENOMEM;
01567                                         goto err_free;
01568                                 }
01569 
01570                                 param.fp_mdt_uuid = tmp;
01571                         } else {
01572                                 param.fp_exclude_obd = !!neg_opt;
01573                                 param.fp_num_alloc_obds += len;
01574                                 tmp = realloc(param.fp_obd_uuid,
01575                                               param.fp_num_alloc_obds *
01576                                               sizeof(*param.fp_obd_uuid));
01577                                 if (tmp == NULL) {
01578                                         ret = -ENOMEM;
01579                                         goto err_free;
01580                                 }
01581 
01582                                 param.fp_obd_uuid = tmp;
01583                         }
01584                         for (token = buf; token && *token; token = next) {
01585                                 struct obd_uuid *puuid;
01586                                 if (c == 'm') {
01587                                         puuid =
01588                                         &param.fp_mdt_uuid[param.fp_num_mdts++];
01589                                 } else {
01590                                         puuid =
01591                                         &param.fp_obd_uuid[param.fp_num_obds++];
01592                                 }
01593                                 p = strchr(token, ',');
01594                                 next = 0;
01595                                 if (p) {
01596                                         *p = 0;
01597                                         next = p+1;
01598                                 }
01599 
01600                                 if (strlen(token) > sizeof(puuid->uuid) - 1) {
01601                                         ret = -E2BIG;
01602                                         goto err_free;
01603                                 }
01604 
01605                                 strncpy(puuid->uuid, token,
01606                                         sizeof(puuid->uuid));
01607                         }
01608 err_free:
01609                         if (buf)
01610                                 free(buf);
01611                         break;
01612                 }
01613                 case 'p':
01614                         param.fp_zero_end = 1;
01615                         break;
01616                 case 'P':
01617                         break;
01618                 case 's':
01619                         if (optarg[0] == '+') {
01620                                 param.fp_size_sign = -1;
01621                                 optarg++;
01622                         } else if (optarg[0] == '-') {
01623                                 param.fp_size_sign =  1;
01624                                 optarg++;
01625                         }
01626 
01627                         ret = llapi_parse_size(optarg, &param.fp_size,
01628                                                &param.fp_size_units, 0);
01629                         if (ret) {
01630                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: bad file size '%s'\n",
01631                                         optarg);
01632                                 goto err;
01633                         }
01634                         param.fp_check_size = 1;
01635                         param.fp_exclude_size = !!neg_opt;
01636                         break;
01637                 case 'S':
01638                         if (optarg[0] == '+') {
01639                                 param.fp_stripe_size_sign = -1;
01640                                 optarg++;
01641                         } else if (optarg[0] == '-') {
01642                                 param.fp_stripe_size_sign =  1;
01643                                 optarg++;
01644                         }
01645 
01646                         ret = llapi_parse_size(optarg, &param.fp_stripe_size,
01647                                                &param.fp_stripe_size_units, 0);
01648                         if (ret) {
01649                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: bad stripe_size '%s'\n",
01650                                         optarg);
01651                                 goto err;
01652                         }
01653                         param.fp_check_stripe_size = 1;
01654                         param.fp_exclude_stripe_size = !!neg_opt;
01655                         break;
01656                 case 't':
01657                         param.fp_exclude_type = !!neg_opt;
01658                         switch (optarg[0]) {
01659                         case 'b':
01660                                 param.fp_type = S_IFBLK;
01661                                 break;
01662                         case 'c':
01663                                 param.fp_type = S_IFCHR;
01664                                 break;
01665                         case 'd':
01666                                 param.fp_type = S_IFDIR;
01667                                 break;
01668                         case 'f':
01669                                 param.fp_type = S_IFREG;
01670                                 break;
01671                         case 'l':
01672                                 param.fp_type = S_IFLNK;
01673                                 break;
01674                         case 'p':
01675                                 param.fp_type = S_IFIFO;
01676                                 break;
01677                         case 's':
01678                                 param.fp_type = S_IFSOCK;
01679                                 break;
01680                         default:
01681                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad type '%s'\n",
01682                                         argv[0], optarg);
01683                                 ret = CMD_HELP;
01684                                 goto err;
01685                         };
01686                         break;
01687                 default:
01688                         ret = CMD_HELP;
01689                         goto err;
01690                 };
01691         }
01692 
01693         if (pathstart == -1) {
01694                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: no filename|pathname\n",
01695                         argv[0]);
01696                 ret = CMD_HELP;
01697                 goto err;
01698         } else if (pathend == -1) {
01699                 /* no options */
01700                 pathend = argc;
01701         }
01702 
01703         do {
01704                 rc = llapi_find(argv[pathstart], &param);
01705                 if (rc != 0 && ret == 0)
01706                         ret = rc;
01707         } while (++pathstart < pathend);
01708 
01709         if (ret)
01710                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s failed for %s.\n",
01711                         argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
01712 err:
01713         if (param.fp_obd_uuid && param.fp_num_alloc_obds)
01714                 free(param.fp_obd_uuid);
01715 
01716         if (param.fp_mdt_uuid && param.fp_num_alloc_mdts)
01717                 free(param.fp_mdt_uuid);
01718 
01719         return ret;
01720 }
01721 
01722 static int lfs_getstripe_internal(int argc, char **argv,
01723                                   struct find_param *param)
01724 {
01725         struct option long_opts[] = {
01726 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01727                 /* This formerly implied "stripe-count", but was explicitly
01728                  * made "stripe-count" for consistency with other options,
01729                  * and to separate it from "mdt-count" when DNE arrives. */
01730                 {"count",               no_argument,            0, 'c'},
01731 #endif
01732                 {"stripe-count",        no_argument,            0, 'c'},
01733                 {"stripe_count",        no_argument,            0, 'c'},
01734                 {"directory",           no_argument,            0, 'd'},
01735                 {"default",             no_argument,            0, 'D'},
01736                 {"generation",          no_argument,            0, 'g'},
01737 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01738                 /* This formerly implied "stripe-index", but was explicitly
01739                  * made "stripe-index" for consistency with other options,
01740                  * and to separate it from "mdt-index" when DNE arrives. */
01741                 {"index",               no_argument,            0, 'i'},
01742 #endif
01743                 {"stripe-index",        no_argument,            0, 'i'},
01744                 {"stripe_index",        no_argument,            0, 'i'},
01745                 {"layout",              no_argument,            0, 'L'},
01746                 {"mdt-index",           no_argument,            0, 'M'},
01747                 {"mdt_index",           no_argument,            0, 'M'},
01748 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01749                 /* This formerly implied "stripe-index", but was confusing
01750                  * with "file offset" (which will eventually be needed for
01751                  * with different layouts by offset), so deprecate it. */
01752                 {"offset",              no_argument,            0, 'o'},
01753 #endif
01754                 {"obd",                 required_argument,      0, 'O'},
01755                 {"ost",                 required_argument,      0, 'O'},
01756                 {"pool",                no_argument,            0, 'p'},
01757                 {"quiet",               no_argument,            0, 'q'},
01758                 {"recursive",           no_argument,            0, 'r'},
01759                 {"raw",                 no_argument,            0, 'R'},
01760 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01761                 /* This formerly implied "--stripe-size", but was confusing
01762                  * with "lfs find --size|-s", which means "file size", so use
01763                  * the consistent "--stripe-size|-S" for all commands. */
01764                 {"size",                no_argument,            0, 's'},
01765 #endif
01766                 {"stripe-size",         no_argument,            0, 'S'},
01767                 {"stripe_size",         no_argument,            0, 'S'},
01768                 {"verbose",             no_argument,            0, 'v'},
01769                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
01770         };
01771         int c, rc;
01772 
01773         param->fp_max_depth = 1;
01774         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "cdDghiLMoO:pqrRsSv",
01775                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
01776                 switch (c) {
01777                 case 'O':
01778                         if (param->fp_obd_uuid) {
01779                                 fprintf(stderr,
01780                                         "error: %s: only one obduuid allowed",
01781                                         argv[0]);
01782                                 return CMD_HELP;
01783                         }
01784                         param->fp_obd_uuid = (struct obd_uuid *)optarg;
01785                         break;
01786                 case 'q':
01787                         param->fp_quiet++;
01788                         break;
01789                 case 'd':
01790                         param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01791                         break;
01792                 case 'D':
01793                         param->fp_get_default_lmv = 1;
01794                         break;
01795                 case 'r':
01796                         param->fp_recursive = 1;
01797                         break;
01798                 case 'v':
01799                         param->fp_verbose = VERBOSE_ALL | VERBOSE_DETAIL;
01800                         break;
01801                 case 'c':
01802 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 6, 53, 0)
01803                         if (strcmp(argv[optind - 1], "--count") == 0)
01804                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--count' deprecated,"
01805                                         " use '--stripe-count' instead\n");
01806 #endif
01807                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL)) {
01808                                 param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_COUNT;
01809                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01810                         }
01811                         break;
01812 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01813                 case 's':
01814 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 6, 53, 0)
01815                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--size|-s' deprecated, "
01816                                 "use '--stripe-size|-S' instead\n");
01817 #endif
01818 #endif /* LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0) */
01819                 case 'S':
01820                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL)) {
01821                                 param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_SIZE;
01822                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01823                         }
01824                         break;
01825 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 53, 0)
01826                 case 'o':
01827                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--offset|-o' deprecated, "
01828                                 "use '--stripe-index|-i' instead\n");
01829 #endif
01830                 case 'i':
01831 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 6, 53, 0)
01832                         if (strcmp(argv[optind - 1], "--index") == 0)
01833                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: '--index' deprecated"
01834                                         ", use '--stripe-index' instead\n");
01835 #endif
01836                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL)) {
01837                                 param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_OFFSET;
01838                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01839                         }
01840                         break;
01841                 case 'p':
01842                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL)) {
01843                                 param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_POOL;
01844                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01845                         }
01846                         break;
01847                 case 'g':
01848                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL)) {
01849                                 param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_GENERATION;
01850                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01851                         }
01852                         break;
01853                 case 'L':
01854                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL)) {
01855                                 param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_LAYOUT;
01856                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01857                         }
01858                         break;
01859                 case 'M':
01860                         if (!(param->fp_verbose & VERBOSE_DETAIL))
01861                                 param->fp_max_depth = 0;
01862                         param->fp_verbose |= VERBOSE_MDTINDEX;
01863                         break;
01864                 case 'R':
01865                         param->fp_raw = 1;
01866                         break;
01867                 default:
01868                         return CMD_HELP;
01869                 }
01870         }
01871 
01872         if (optind >= argc)
01873                 return CMD_HELP;
01874 
01875         if (param->fp_recursive)
01876                 param->fp_max_depth = -1;
01877 
01878         if (!param->fp_verbose)
01879                 param->fp_verbose = VERBOSE_ALL;
01880         if (param->fp_quiet)
01881                 param->fp_verbose = VERBOSE_OBJID;
01882 
01883         do {
01884                 rc = llapi_getstripe(argv[optind], param);
01885         } while (++optind < argc && !rc);
01886 
01887         if (rc)
01888                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s failed for %s.\n",
01889                         argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
01890         return rc;
01891 }
01892 
01893 static int lfs_tgts(int argc, char **argv)
01894 {
01895         char mntdir[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'}, path[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'};
01896         struct find_param param;
01897         int index = 0, rc=0;
01898 
01899         if (argc > 2)
01900                 return CMD_HELP;
01901 
01902         if (argc == 2 && !realpath(argv[1], path)) {
01903                 rc = -errno;
01904                 fprintf(stderr, "error: invalid path '%s': %s\n",
01905                         argv[1], strerror(-rc));
01906                 return rc;
01907         }
01908 
01909         while (!llapi_search_mounts(path, index++, mntdir, NULL)) {
01910                 /* Check if we have a mount point */
01911                 if (mntdir[0] == '\0')
01912                         continue;
01913 
01914                 memset(&param, 0, sizeof(param));
01915                 if (!strcmp(argv[0], "mdts"))
01916                         param.fp_get_lmv = 1;
01917 
01918                 rc = llapi_ostlist(mntdir, &param);
01919                 if (rc) {
01920                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: failed on %s\n",
01921                                 argv[0], mntdir);
01922                 }
01923                 if (path[0] != '\0')
01924                         break;
01925                 memset(mntdir, 0, PATH_MAX);
01926         }
01927 
01928         return rc;
01929 }
01930 
01931 static int lfs_getstripe(int argc, char **argv)
01932 {
01933         struct find_param param = { 0 };
01934         return lfs_getstripe_internal(argc, argv, &param);
01935 }
01936 
01937 /* functions */
01938 static int lfs_getdirstripe(int argc, char **argv)
01939 {
01940         struct find_param param = { 0 };
01941 
01942         param.fp_get_lmv = 1;
01943         return lfs_getstripe_internal(argc, argv, &param);
01944 }
01945 
01946 /* functions */
01947 static int lfs_setdirstripe(int argc, char **argv)
01948 {
01949         char                    *dname;
01950         int                     result;
01951         unsigned int            stripe_offset = -1;
01952         unsigned int            stripe_count = 1;
01953         enum lmv_hash_type      hash_type;
01954         char                    *end;
01955         int                     c;
01956         char                    *stripe_offset_opt = NULL;
01957         char                    *stripe_count_opt = NULL;
01958         char                    *stripe_hash_opt = NULL;
01959         char                    *mode_opt = NULL;
01960         bool                    default_stripe = false;
01961         mode_t                  mode = S_IRWXU | S_IRWXG | S_IRWXO;
01962         mode_t                  previous_mode = 0;
01963         bool                    delete = false;
01964 
01965         struct option long_opts[] = {
01966                 {"count",       required_argument, 0, 'c'},
01967                 {"delete",      no_argument, 0, 'd'},
01968                 {"index",       required_argument, 0, 'i'},
01969                 {"mode",        required_argument, 0, 'm'},
01970                 {"hash-type",   required_argument, 0, 't'},
01971                 {"default_stripe", no_argument, 0, 'D'},
01972                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
01973         };
01974 
01975         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "c:dDi:m:t:", long_opts,
01976                                 NULL)) >= 0) {
01977                 switch (c) {
01978                 case 0:
01979                         /* Long options. */
01980                         break;
01981                 case 'c':
01982                         stripe_count_opt = optarg;
01983                         break;
01984                 case 'd':
01985                         delete = true;
01986                         default_stripe = true;
01987                         break;
01988                 case 'D':
01989                         default_stripe = true;
01990                         break;
01991                 case 'i':
01992                         stripe_offset_opt = optarg;
01993                         break;
01994                 case 'm':
01995                         mode_opt = optarg;
01996                         break;
01997                 case 't':
01998                         stripe_hash_opt = optarg;
01999                         break;
02000                 default:
02001                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' "
02002                                         "unrecognized\n",
02003                                         argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
02004                         return CMD_HELP;
02005                 }
02006         }
02007 
02008         if (optind == argc) {
02009                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: missing dirname\n",
02010                         argv[0]);
02011                 return CMD_HELP;
02012         }
02013 
02014         if (!delete && stripe_offset_opt == NULL && stripe_count_opt == NULL) {
02015                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: missing stripe offset and count.\n",
02016                         argv[0]);
02017                 return CMD_HELP;
02018         }
02019 
02020         if (stripe_offset_opt != NULL) {
02021                 /* get the stripe offset */
02022                 stripe_offset = strtoul(stripe_offset_opt, &end, 0);
02023                 if (*end != '\0') {
02024                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe offset '%s'\n",
02025                                 argv[0], stripe_offset_opt);
02026                         return CMD_HELP;
02027                 }
02028         }
02029 
02030         if (delete) {
02031                 if (stripe_offset_opt != NULL || stripe_count_opt != NULL) {
02032                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot specify -d with -s,"
02033                                 " or -i options.\n", argv[0]);
02034                         return CMD_HELP;
02035                 } else {
02036                         stripe_count = 0;
02037                 }
02038         }
02039 
02040 
02041         if (mode_opt != NULL) {
02042                 mode = strtoul(mode_opt, &end, 8);
02043                 if (*end != '\0') {
02044                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad mode '%s'\n",
02045                                 argv[0], mode_opt);
02046                         return CMD_HELP;
02047                 }
02048                 previous_mode = umask(0);
02049         }
02050 
02051         if (stripe_hash_opt == NULL ||
02052             strcmp(stripe_hash_opt, LMV_HASH_NAME_FNV_1A_64) == 0) {
02053                 hash_type = LMV_HASH_TYPE_FNV_1A_64;
02054         } else if (strcmp(stripe_hash_opt, LMV_HASH_NAME_ALL_CHARS) == 0) {
02055                 hash_type = LMV_HASH_TYPE_ALL_CHARS;
02056         } else {
02057                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe hash type '%s'\n",
02058                         argv[0], stripe_hash_opt);
02059                 return CMD_HELP;
02060         }
02061 
02062         /* get the stripe count */
02063         if (stripe_count_opt != NULL) {
02064                 stripe_count = strtoul(stripe_count_opt, &end, 0);
02065                 if (*end != '\0') {
02066                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe count '%s'\n",
02067                                 argv[0], stripe_count_opt);
02068                         return CMD_HELP;
02069                 }
02070         }
02071 
02072         dname = argv[optind];
02073         do {
02074                 if (default_stripe) {
02075                         result = llapi_dir_set_default_lmv_stripe(dname,
02076                                                     stripe_offset, stripe_count,
02077                                                     hash_type, NULL);
02078                 } else {
02079                         result = llapi_dir_create_pool(dname, mode,
02080                                                        stripe_offset,
02081                                                        stripe_count, hash_type,
02082                                                        NULL);
02083                 }
02084 
02085                 if (result) {
02086                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: create stripe dir '%s' "
02087                                 "failed\n", argv[0], dname);
02088                         break;
02089                 }
02090                 dname = argv[++optind];
02091         } while (dname != NULL);
02092 
02093         if (mode_opt != NULL)
02094                 umask(previous_mode);
02095 
02096         return result;
02097 }
02098 
02099 /* functions */
02100 static int lfs_rmentry(int argc, char **argv)
02101 {
02102         char *dname;
02103         int   index;
02104         int   result = 0;
02105 
02106         if (argc <= 1) {
02107                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: missing dirname\n",
02108                         argv[0]);
02109                 return CMD_HELP;
02110         }
02111
