02112         index = 1;
02113         dname = argv[index];
02114         while (dname != NULL) {
02115                 result = llapi_direntry_remove(dname);
02116                 if (result) {
02117                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: remove dir entry '%s' "
02118                                 "failed\n", argv[0], dname);
02119                         break;
02120                 }
02121                 dname = argv[++index];
02122         }
02123         return result;
02124 }
02125 
02126 static int lfs_mv(int argc, char **argv)
02127 {
02128         struct  find_param param = {
02129                 .fp_max_depth = -1,
02130                 .fp_mdt_index = -1,
02131         };
02132         char   *end;
02133         int     c;
02134         int     rc = 0;
02135         struct option long_opts[] = {
02136                 {"mdt-index", required_argument, 0, 'M'},
02137                 {"verbose",     no_argument,       0, 'v'},
02138                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
02139         };
02140 
02141         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "M:v", long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
02142                 switch (c) {
02143                 case 'M': {
02144                         param.fp_mdt_index = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
02145                         if (*end != '\0') {
02146                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: invalid MDT index'%s'\n",
02147                                         argv[0], optarg);
02148                                 return CMD_HELP;
02149                         }
02150                         break;
02151                 }
02152                 case 'v': {
02153                         param.fp_verbose = VERBOSE_DETAIL;
02154                         break;
02155                 }
02156                 default:
02157                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: unrecognized option '%s'\n",
02158                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
02159                         return CMD_HELP;
02160                 }
02161         }
02162 
02163         if (param.fp_mdt_index == -1) {
02164                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: MDT index must be specified\n", argv[0]);
02165                 return CMD_HELP;
02166         }
02167 
02168         if (optind >= argc) {
02169                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: missing operand path\n", argv[0]);
02170                 return CMD_HELP;
02171         }
02172 
02173         param.fp_migrate = 1;
02174         rc = llapi_migrate_mdt(argv[optind], &param);
02175         if (rc != 0)
02176                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot migrate '%s' to MDT%04x: %s\n",
02177                         argv[0], argv[optind], param.fp_mdt_index,
02178                         strerror(-rc));
02179         return rc;
02180 }
02181 
02182 static int lfs_osts(int argc, char **argv)
02183 {
02184         return lfs_tgts(argc, argv);
02185 }
02186 
02187 static int lfs_mdts(int argc, char **argv)
02188 {
02189         return lfs_tgts(argc, argv);
02190 }
02191 
02192 #define COOK(value)                                                     \
02193 ({                                                                      \
02194         int radix = 0;                                                  \
02195         while (value > 1024) {                                          \
02196                 value /= 1024;                                          \
02197                 radix++;                                                \
02198         }                                                               \
02199         radix;                                                          \
02200 })
02201 #define UUF     "%-20s"
02202 #define CSF     "%11s"
02203 #define CDF     "%11llu"
02204 #define HDF     "%8.1f%c"
02205 #define RSF     "%4s"
02206 #define RDF     "%3d%%"
02207 
02208 static int showdf(char *mntdir, struct obd_statfs *stat,
02209                   char *uuid, int ishow, int cooked,
02210                   char *type, int index, int rc)
02211 {
02212         long long avail, used, total;
02213         double ratio = 0;
02214         char *suffix = "KMGTPEZY";
02215         /* Note if we have >2^64 bytes/fs these buffers will need to be grown */
02216         char tbuf[3 * sizeof(__u64)];
02217         char ubuf[3 * sizeof(__u64)];
02218         char abuf[3 * sizeof(__u64)];
02219         char rbuf[3 * sizeof(__u64)];
02220 
02221         if (!uuid || !stat)
02222                 return -EINVAL;
02223 
02224         switch (rc) {
02225         case 0:
02226                 if (ishow) {
02227                         avail = stat->os_ffree;
02228                         used = stat->os_files - stat->os_ffree;
02229                         total = stat->os_files;
02230                 } else {
02231                         int shift = cooked ? 0 : 10;
02232 
02233                         avail = (stat->os_bavail * stat->os_bsize) >> shift;
02234                         used  = ((stat->os_blocks - stat->os_bfree) *
02235                                  stat->os_bsize) >> shift;
02236                         total = (stat->os_blocks * stat->os_bsize) >> shift;
02237                 }
02238 
02239                 if ((used + avail) > 0)
02240                         ratio = (double)used / (double)(used + avail);
02241 
02242                 if (cooked) {
02243                         int i;
02244                         double cook_val;
02245 
02246                         cook_val = (double)total;
02247                         i = COOK(cook_val);
02248                         if (i > 0)
02249                                 sprintf(tbuf, HDF, cook_val, suffix[i - 1]);
02250                         else
02251                                 sprintf(tbuf, CDF, total);
02252 
02253                         cook_val = (double)used;
02254                         i = COOK(cook_val);
02255                         if (i > 0)
02256                                 sprintf(ubuf, HDF, cook_val, suffix[i - 1]);
02257                         else
02258                                 sprintf(ubuf, CDF, used);
02259 
02260                         cook_val = (double)avail;
02261                         i = COOK(cook_val);
02262                         if (i > 0)
02263                                 sprintf(abuf, HDF, cook_val, suffix[i - 1]);
02264                         else
02265                                 sprintf(abuf, CDF, avail);
02266                 } else {
02267                         sprintf(tbuf, CDF, total);
02268                         sprintf(ubuf, CDF, used);
02269                         sprintf(abuf, CDF, avail);
02270                 }
02271 
02272                 sprintf(rbuf, RDF, (int)(ratio * 100 + 0.5));
02273                 printf(UUF" "CSF" "CSF" "CSF" "RSF" %-s",
02274                        uuid, tbuf, ubuf, abuf, rbuf, mntdir);
02275                 if (type)
02276                         printf("[%s:%d]\n", type, index);
02277                 else
02278                         printf("\n");
02279 
02280                 break;
02281         case -ENODATA:
02282                 printf(UUF": inactive device\n", uuid);
02283                 break;
02284         default:
02285                 printf(UUF": %s\n", uuid, strerror(-rc));
02286                 break;
02287         }
02288 
02289         return 0;
02290 }
02291 
02292 struct ll_stat_type {
02293         int   st_op;
02294         char *st_name;
02295 };
02296 
02297 static int mntdf(char *mntdir, char *fsname, char *pool, int ishow,
02298                 int cooked, int lazy)
02299 {
02300         struct obd_statfs stat_buf, sum = { .os_bsize = 1 };
02301         struct obd_uuid uuid_buf;
02302         char *poolname = NULL;
02303         struct ll_stat_type types[] = { { LL_STATFS_LMV, "MDT" },
02304                                         { LL_STATFS_LOV, "OST" },
02305                                         { 0, NULL } };
02306         struct ll_stat_type *tp;
02307         __u64 ost_ffree = 0;
02308         __u32 index;
02309         __u32 type;
02310         int rc;
02311 
02312         if (pool) {
02313                 poolname = strchr(pool, '.');
02314                 if (poolname != NULL) {
02315                         if (strncmp(fsname, pool, strlen(fsname))) {
02316                                 fprintf(stderr, "filesystem name incorrect\n");
02317                                 return -ENODEV;
02318                         }
02319                         poolname++;
02320                 } else
02321                         poolname = pool;
02322         }
02323 
02324         if (ishow)
02325                 printf(UUF" "CSF" "CSF" "CSF" "RSF" %-s\n",
02326                        "UUID", "Inodes", "IUsed", "IFree",
02327                        "IUse%", "Mounted on");
02328         else
02329                 printf(UUF" "CSF" "CSF" "CSF" "RSF" %-s\n",
02330                        "UUID", cooked ? "bytes" : "1K-blocks",
02331                        "Used", "Available", "Use%", "Mounted on");
02332 
02333         for (tp = types; tp->st_name != NULL; tp++) {
02334                 for (index = 0; ; index++) {
02335                         memset(&stat_buf, 0, sizeof(struct obd_statfs));
02336                         memset(&uuid_buf, 0, sizeof(struct obd_uuid));
02337                         type = lazy ? tp->st_op | LL_STATFS_NODELAY : tp->st_op;
02338                         rc = llapi_obd_statfs(mntdir, type, index,
02339                                               &stat_buf, &uuid_buf);
02340                         if (rc == -ENODEV)
02341                                 break;
02342 
02343                         if (rc == -EAGAIN)
02344                                 continue;
02345 
02346                         if (poolname && tp->st_op == LL_STATFS_LOV &&
02347                             llapi_search_ost(fsname, poolname,
02348                                              obd_uuid2str(&uuid_buf)) != 1)
02349                                 continue;
02350 
02351                         /* the llapi_obd_statfs() call may have returned with
02352                          * an error, but if it filled in uuid_buf we will at
02353                          * lease use that to print out a message for that OBD.
02354                          * If we didn't get anything in the uuid_buf, then fill
02355                          * it in so that we can print an error message. */
02356                         if (uuid_buf.uuid[0] == '\0')
02357                                 sprintf(uuid_buf.uuid, "%s%04x",
02358                                         tp->st_name, index);
02359                         showdf(mntdir, &stat_buf, obd_uuid2str(&uuid_buf),
02360                                ishow, cooked, tp->st_name, index, rc);
02361 
02362                         if (rc == 0) {
02363                                 if (tp->st_op == LL_STATFS_LMV) {
02364                                         sum.os_ffree += stat_buf.os_ffree;
02365                                         sum.os_files += stat_buf.os_files;
02366                                 } else /* if (tp->st_op == LL_STATFS_LOV) */ {
02367                                         sum.os_blocks += stat_buf.os_blocks *
02368                                                 stat_buf.os_bsize;
02369                                         sum.os_bfree  += stat_buf.os_bfree *
02370                                                 stat_buf.os_bsize;
02371                                         sum.os_bavail += stat_buf.os_bavail *
02372                                                 stat_buf.os_bsize;
02373                                         ost_ffree += stat_buf.os_ffree;
02374                                 }
02375                         } else if (rc == -EINVAL || rc == -EFAULT) {
02376                                 break;
02377                         }
02378                 }
02379         }
02380 
02381         /* If we don't have as many objects free on the OST as inodes
02382          * on the MDS, we reduce the total number of inodes to
02383          * compensate, so that the "inodes in use" number is correct.
02384          * Matches ll_statfs_internal() so the results are consistent. */
02385         if (ost_ffree < sum.os_ffree) {
02386                 sum.os_files = (sum.os_files - sum.os_ffree) + ost_ffree;
02387                 sum.os_ffree = ost_ffree;
02388         }
02389         printf("\n");
02390         showdf(mntdir, &sum, "filesystem summary:", ishow, cooked, NULL, 0, 0);
02391         printf("\n");
02392         return 0;
02393 }
02394 
02395 static int lfs_df(int argc, char **argv)
02396 {
02397         char mntdir[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'}, path[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'};
02398         int ishow = 0, cooked = 0;
02399         int lazy = 0;
02400         int c, rc = 0, index = 0;
02401         char fsname[PATH_MAX] = "", *pool_name = NULL;
02402         struct option long_opts[] = {
02403                 {"pool", required_argument, 0, 'p'},
02404                 {"lazy", 0, 0, 'l'},
02405                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
02406         };
02407 
02408         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "hilp:", long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
02409                 switch (c) {
02410                 case 'i':
02411                         ishow = 1;
02412                         break;
02413                 case 'h':
02414                         cooked = 1;
02415                         break;
02416                 case 'l':
02417                         lazy = 1;
02418                         break;
02419                 case 'p':
02420                         pool_name = optarg;
02421                         break;
02422                 default:
02423                         return CMD_HELP;
02424                 }
02425         }
02426         if (optind < argc && !realpath(argv[optind], path)) {
02427                 rc = -errno;
02428                 fprintf(stderr, "error: invalid path '%s': %s\n",
02429                         argv[optind], strerror(-rc));
02430                 return rc;
02431         }
02432 
02433         while (!llapi_search_mounts(path, index++, mntdir, fsname)) {
02434                 /* Check if we have a mount point */
02435                 if (mntdir[0] == '\0')
02436                         continue;
02437 
02438                 rc = mntdf(mntdir, fsname, pool_name, ishow, cooked, lazy);
02439                 if (rc || path[0] != '\0')
02440                         break;
02441                 fsname[0] = '\0'; /* avoid matching in next loop */
02442                 mntdir[0] = '\0'; /* avoid matching in next loop */
02443         }
02444 
02445         return rc;
02446 }
02447 
02448 static int lfs_getname(int argc, char **argv)
02449 {
02450         char mntdir[PATH_MAX] = "", path[PATH_MAX] = "", fsname[PATH_MAX] = "";
02451         int rc = 0, index = 0, c;
02452         char buf[sizeof(struct obd_uuid)];
02453 
02454         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "h")) != -1)
02455                 return CMD_HELP;
02456 
02457         if (optind == argc) { /* no paths specified, get all paths. */
02458                 while (!llapi_search_mounts(path, index++, mntdir, fsname)) {
02459                         rc = llapi_getname(mntdir, buf, sizeof(buf));
02460                         if (rc < 0) {
02461                                 fprintf(stderr,
02462                                         "cannot get name for `%s': %s\n",
02463                                         mntdir, strerror(-rc));
02464                                 break;
02465                         }
02466 
02467                         printf("%s %s\n", buf, mntdir);
02468 
02469                         path[0] = fsname[0] = mntdir[0] = 0;
02470                 }
02471         } else { /* paths specified, only attempt to search these. */
02472                 for (; optind < argc; optind++) {
02473                         rc = llapi_getname(argv[optind], buf, sizeof(buf));
02474                         if (rc < 0) {
02475                                 fprintf(stderr,
02476                                         "cannot get name for `%s': %s\n",
02477                                         argv[optind], strerror(-rc));
02478                                 break;
02479                         }
02480 
02481                         printf("%s %s\n", buf, argv[optind]);
02482                 }
02483         }
02484         return rc;
02485 }
02486 
02487 static int lfs_check(int argc, char **argv)
02488 {
02489         int rc;
02490         char mntdir[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'};
02491         int num_types = 1;
02492         char *obd_types[2];
02493         char obd_type1[4];
02494         char obd_type2[4];
02495 
02496         if (argc != 2)
02497                 return CMD_HELP;
02498 
02499         obd_types[0] = obd_type1;
02500         obd_types[1] = obd_type2;
02501 
02502         if (strcmp(argv[1], "osts") == 0) {
02503                 strcpy(obd_types[0], "osc");
02504         } else if (strcmp(argv[1], "mds") == 0) {
02505                 strcpy(obd_types[0], "mdc");
02506         } else if (strcmp(argv[1], "servers") == 0) {
02507                 num_types = 2;
02508                 strcpy(obd_types[0], "osc");
02509                 strcpy(obd_types[1], "mdc");
02510         } else {
02511                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
02512                                 argv[0], argv[1]);
02513                         return CMD_HELP;
02514         }
02515 
02516         rc = llapi_search_mounts(NULL, 0, mntdir, NULL);
02517         if (rc < 0 || mntdir[0] == '\0') {
02518                 fprintf(stderr, "No suitable Lustre mount found\n");
02519                 return rc;
02520         }
02521 
02522         rc = llapi_target_check(num_types, obd_types, mntdir);
02523         if (rc)
02524                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s status failed\n",
02525                                 argv[0],argv[1]);
02526 
02527         return rc;
02528 
02529 }
02530 
02531 static int lfs_join(int argc, char **argv)
02532 {
02533         fprintf(stderr, "join two lustre files into one.\n"
02534                         "obsolete, HEAD does not support it anymore.\n");
02535         return 0;
02536 }
02537 
02538 #ifdef HAVE_SYS_QUOTA_H
02539 #define ARG2INT(nr, str, msg)                                           \
02540 do {                                                                    \
02541         char *endp;                                                     \
02542         nr = strtol(str, &endp, 0);                                     \
02543         if (*endp) {                                                    \
02544                 fprintf(stderr, "error: bad %s: %s\n", msg, str);       \
02545                 return CMD_HELP;                                        \
02546         }                                                               \
02547 } while (0)
02548 
02549 #define ADD_OVERFLOW(a,b) ((a + b) < a) ? (a = ULONG_MAX) : (a = a + b)
02550 
02551 /* Convert format time string "XXwXXdXXhXXmXXs" into seconds value
02552  * returns the value or ULONG_MAX on integer overflow or incorrect format
02553  * Notes:
02554  *        1. the order of specifiers is arbitrary (may be: 5w3s or 3s5w)
02555  *        2. specifiers may be encountered multiple times (2s3s is 5 seconds)
02556  *        3. empty integer value is interpreted as 0
02557  */
02558 static unsigned long str2sec(const char* timestr)
02559 {
02560         const char spec[] = "smhdw";
02561         const unsigned long mult[] = {1, 60, 60*60, 24*60*60, 7*24*60*60};
02562         unsigned long val = 0;
02563         char *tail;
02564 
02565         if (strpbrk(timestr, spec) == NULL) {
02566                 /* no specifiers inside the time string,
02567                    should treat it as an integer value */
02568                 val = strtoul(timestr, &tail, 10);
02569                 return *tail ? ULONG_MAX : val;
02570         }
02571 
02572         /* format string is XXwXXdXXhXXmXXs */
02573         while (*timestr) {
02574                 unsigned long v;
02575                 int ind;
02576                 char* ptr;
02577 
02578                 v = strtoul(timestr, &tail, 10);
02579                 if (v == ULONG_MAX || *tail == '\0')
02580                         /* value too large (ULONG_MAX or more)
02581                            or missing specifier */
02582                         goto error;
02583 
02584                 ptr = strchr(spec, *tail);
02585                 if (ptr == NULL)
02586                         /* unknown specifier */
02587                         goto error;
02588 
02589                 ind = ptr - spec;
02590 
02591                 /* check if product will overflow the type */
02592                 if (!(v < ULONG_MAX / mult[ind]))
02593                         goto error;
02594 
02595                 ADD_OVERFLOW(val, mult[ind] * v);
02596                 if (val == ULONG_MAX)
02597                         goto error;
02598 
02599                 timestr = tail + 1;
02600         }
02601 
02602         return val;
02603 
02604 error:
02605         return ULONG_MAX;
02606 }
02607 
02608 #define ARG2ULL(nr, str, def_units)                                     \
02609 do {                                                                    \
02610         unsigned long long limit, units = def_units;                    \
02611         int rc;                                                         \
02612                                                                         \
02613         rc = llapi_parse_size(str, &limit, &units, 1);                  \
02614         if (rc < 0) {                                                   \
02615                 fprintf(stderr, "error: bad limit value %s\n", str);    \
02616                 return CMD_HELP;                                        \
02617         }                                                               \
02618         nr = limit;                                                     \
02619 } while (0)
02620 
02621 static inline int has_times_option(int argc, char **argv)
02622 {
02623         int i;
02624 
02625         for (i = 1; i < argc; i++)
02626                 if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-t"))
02627                         return 1;
02628 
02629         return 0;
02630 }
02631 
02632 int lfs_setquota_times(int argc, char **argv)
02633 {
02634         int c, rc;
02635         struct if_quotactl qctl;
02636         char *mnt, *obd_type = (char *)qctl.obd_type;
02637         struct obd_dqblk *dqb = &qctl.qc_dqblk;
02638         struct obd_dqinfo *dqi = &qctl.qc_dqinfo;
02639         struct option long_opts[] = {
02640                 {"block-grace",     required_argument, 0, 'b'},
02641                 {"group",           no_argument,       0, 'g'},
02642                 {"inode-grace",     required_argument, 0, 'i'},
02643                 {"times",           no_argument,       0, 't'},
02644                 {"user",            no_argument,       0, 'u'},
02645                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
02646         };
02647 
02648         memset(&qctl, 0, sizeof(qctl));
02649         qctl.qc_cmd  = LUSTRE_Q_SETINFO;
02650         qctl.qc_type = UGQUOTA;
02651 
02652         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "b:gi:tu", long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
02653                 switch (c) {
02654                 case 'u':
02655                 case 'g':
02656                         if (qctl.qc_type != UGQUOTA) {
02657                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: -u and -g can't be used "
02658                                                 "more than once\n");
02659                                 return CMD_HELP;
02660                         }
02661                         qctl.qc_type = (c == 'u') ? USRQUOTA : GRPQUOTA;
02662                         break;
02663                 case 'b':
02664                         if ((dqi->dqi_bgrace = str2sec(optarg)) == ULONG_MAX) {
02665                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: bad block-grace: %s\n",
02666                                         optarg);
02667                                 return CMD_HELP;
02668                         }
02669                         dqb->dqb_valid |= QIF_BTIME;
02670                         break;
02671                 case 'i':
02672                         if ((dqi->dqi_igrace = str2sec(optarg)) == ULONG_MAX) {
02673                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: bad inode-grace: %s\n",
02674                                         optarg);
02675                                 return CMD_HELP;
02676                         }
02677                         dqb->dqb_valid |= QIF_ITIME;
02678                         break;
02679                 case 't': /* Yes, of course! */
02680                         break;
02681                 default: /* getopt prints error message for us when opterr != 0 */
02682                         return CMD_HELP;
02683                 }
02684         }
02685 
02686         if (qctl.qc_type == UGQUOTA) {
02687                 fprintf(stderr, "error: neither -u nor -g specified\n");
02688                 return CMD_HELP;
02689         }
02690 
02691         if (optind != argc - 1) {
02692                 fprintf(stderr, "error: unexpected parameters encountered\n");
02693                 return CMD_HELP;
02694         }
02695 
02696         mnt = argv[optind];
02697         rc = llapi_quotactl(mnt, &qctl);
02698         if (rc) {
02699                 if (*obd_type)
02700                         fprintf(stderr, "%s %s ", obd_type,
02701                                 obd_uuid2str(&qctl.obd_uuid));
02702                 fprintf(stderr, "setquota failed: %s\n", strerror(-rc));
02703                 return rc;
02704         }
02705 
02706         return 0;
02707 }
02708 
02709 #define BSLIMIT (1 << 0)
02710 #define BHLIMIT (1 << 1)
02711 #define ISLIMIT (1 << 2)
02712 #define IHLIMIT (1 << 3)
02713 
02714 int lfs_setquota(int argc, char **argv)
02715 {
02716         int c, rc;
02717         struct if_quotactl qctl;
02718         char *mnt, *obd_type = (char *)qctl.obd_type;
02719         struct obd_dqblk *dqb = &qctl.qc_dqblk;
02720         struct option long_opts[] = {
02721                 {"block-softlimit", required_argument, 0, 'b'},
02722                 {"block-hardlimit", required_argument, 0, 'B'},
02723                 {"group",           required_argument, 0, 'g'},
02724                 {"inode-softlimit", required_argument, 0, 'i'},
02725                 {"inode-hardlimit", required_argument, 0, 'I'},
02726                 {"user",            required_argument, 0, 'u'},
02727                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
02728         };
02729         unsigned limit_mask = 0;
02730         char *endptr;
02731 
02732         if (has_times_option(argc, argv))
02733                 return lfs_setquota_times(argc, argv);
02734 
02735         memset(&qctl, 0, sizeof(qctl));
02736         qctl.qc_cmd  = LUSTRE_Q_SETQUOTA;
02737         qctl.qc_type = UGQUOTA; /* UGQUOTA makes no sense for setquota,
02738                                  * so it can be used as a marker that qc_type
02739                                  * isn't reinitialized from command line */
02740 
02741         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "b:B:g:i:I:u:", long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
02742                 switch (c) {
02743                 case 'u':
02744                 case 'g':
02745                         if (qctl.qc_type != UGQUOTA) {
02746                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: -u and -g can't be used"
02747                                                 " more than once\n");
02748                                 return CMD_HELP;
02749                         }
02750                         qctl.qc_type = (c == 'u') ? USRQUOTA : GRPQUOTA;
02751                         rc = name2id(&qctl.qc_id, optarg,
02752                                      (qctl.qc_type == USRQUOTA) ? USER : GROUP);
02753                         if (rc) {
02754                                 qctl.qc_id = strtoul(optarg, &endptr, 10);
02755                                 if (*endptr != '\0') {
02756                                         fprintf(stderr, "error: can't find id "
02757                                                 "for name %s\n", optarg);
02758                                         return CMD_HELP;
02759                                 }
02760                         }
02761                         break;
02762                 case 'b':
02763                         ARG2ULL(dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit, optarg, 1024);
02764                         dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit >>= 10;
02765                         limit_mask |= BSLIMIT;
02766                         if (dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit &&
02767                             dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit <= 1024) /* <= 1M? */
02768                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: block softlimit is "
02769                                         "smaller than the miminal qunit size, "
02770                                         "please see the help of setquota or "
02771                                         "Lustre manual for details.\n");
02772                         break;
02773                 case 'B':
02774                         ARG2ULL(dqb->dqb_bhardlimit, optarg, 1024);
02775                         dqb->dqb_bhardlimit >>= 10;
02776                         limit_mask |= BHLIMIT;
02777                         if (dqb->dqb_bhardlimit &&
02778                             dqb->dqb_bhardlimit <= 1024) /* <= 1M? */
02779                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: block hardlimit is "
02780                                         "smaller than the miminal qunit size, "
02781                                         "please see the help of setquota or "
02782                                         "Lustre manual for details.\n");
02783                         break;
02784                 case 'i':
02785                         ARG2ULL(dqb->dqb_isoftlimit, optarg, 1);
02786                         limit_mask |= ISLIMIT;
02787                         if (dqb->dqb_isoftlimit &&
02788                             dqb->dqb_isoftlimit <= 1024) /* <= 1K inodes? */
02789                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: inode softlimit is "
02790                                         "smaller than the miminal qunit size, "
02791                                         "please see the help of setquota or "
02792                                         "Lustre manual for details.\n");
02793                         break;
02794                 case 'I':
02795                         ARG2ULL(dqb->dqb_ihardlimit, optarg, 1);
02796                         limit_mask |= IHLIMIT;
02797                         if (dqb->dqb_ihardlimit &&
02798                             dqb->dqb_ihardlimit <= 1024) /* <= 1K inodes? */
02799                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: inode hardlimit is "
02800                                         "smaller than the miminal qunit size, "
02801                                         "please see the help of setquota or "
02802                                         "Lustre manual for details.\n");
02803                         break;
02804                 default: /* getopt prints error message for us when opterr != 0 */
02805                         return CMD_HELP;
02806                 }
02807         }
02808 
02809         if (qctl.qc_type == UGQUOTA) {
02810                 fprintf(stderr, "error: neither -u nor -g was specified\n");
02811                 return CMD_HELP;
02812         }
02813 
02814         if (limit_mask == 0) {
02815                 fprintf(stderr, "error: at least one limit must be specified\n");
02816                 return CMD_HELP;
02817         }
02818 
02819         if (optind != argc - 1) {
02820                 fprintf(stderr, "error: unexpected parameters encountered\n");
02821                 return CMD_HELP;
02822         }
02823 
02824         mnt = argv[optind];
02825 
02826         if ((!(limit_mask & BHLIMIT) ^ !(limit_mask & BSLIMIT)) ||
02827             (!(limit_mask & IHLIMIT) ^ !(limit_mask & ISLIMIT))) {
02828                 /* sigh, we can't just set blimits/ilimits */
02829                 struct if_quotactl tmp_qctl = {.qc_cmd  = LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA,
02830                                                .qc_type = qctl.qc_type,
02831                                                .qc_id   = qctl.qc_id};
02832 
02833                 rc = llapi_quotactl(mnt, &tmp_qctl);
02834                 if (rc < 0) {
02835                         fprintf(stderr, "error: setquota failed while retrieving"
02836                                         " current quota settings (%s)\n",
02837                                         strerror(-rc));
02838                         return rc;
02839                 }
02840 
02841                 if (!(limit_mask & BHLIMIT))
02842                         dqb->dqb_bhardlimit = tmp_qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_bhardlimit;
02843                 if (!(limit_mask & BSLIMIT))
02844                         dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit = tmp_qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_bsoftlimit;
02845                 if (!(limit_mask & IHLIMIT))
02846                         dqb->dqb_ihardlimit = tmp_qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_ihardlimit;
02847                 if (!(limit_mask & ISLIMIT))
02848                         dqb->dqb_isoftlimit = tmp_qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_isoftlimit;
02849 
02850                 /* Keep grace times if we have got no softlimit arguments */
02851                 if ((limit_mask & BHLIMIT) && !(limit_mask & BSLIMIT)) {
02852                         dqb->dqb_valid |= QIF_BTIME;
02853                         dqb->dqb_btime = tmp_qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_btime;
02854                 }
02855 
02856                 if ((limit_mask & IHLIMIT) && !(limit_mask & ISLIMIT)) {
02857                         dqb->dqb_valid |= QIF_ITIME;
02858                         dqb->dqb_itime = tmp_qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_itime;
02859                 }
02860         }
02861 
02862         dqb->dqb_valid |= (limit_mask & (BHLIMIT | BSLIMIT)) ? QIF_BLIMITS : 0;
02863         dqb->dqb_valid |= (limit_mask & (IHLIMIT | ISLIMIT)) ? QIF_ILIMITS : 0;
02864 
02865         rc = llapi_quotactl(mnt, &qctl);
02866         if (rc) {
02867                 if (*obd_type)
02868                         fprintf(stderr, "%s %s ", obd_type,
02869                                 obd_uuid2str(&qctl.obd_uuid));
02870                 fprintf(stderr, "setquota failed: %s\n", strerror(-rc));
02871                 return rc;
02872         }
02873 
02874         return 0;
02875 }
02876 
02877 static inline char *type2name(int check_type)
02878 {
02879         if (check_type == USRQUOTA)
02880                 return "user";
02881         else if (check_type == GRPQUOTA)
02882                 return "group";
02883         else
02884                 return "unknown";
02885 }
02886 
02887 /* Converts seconds value into format string
02888  * result is returned in buf
02889  * Notes:
02890  *        1. result is in descenting order: 1w2d3h4m5s
02891  *        2. zero fields are not filled (except for p. 3): 5d1s
02892  *        3. zero seconds value is presented as "0s"
02893  */
02894 static char * __sec2str(time_t seconds, char *buf)
02895 {
02896         const char spec[] = "smhdw";
02897         const unsigned long mult[] = {1, 60, 60*60, 24*60*60, 7*24*60*60};
02898         unsigned long c;
02899         char *tail = buf;
02900         int i;
02901 
02902         for (i = sizeof(mult) / sizeof(mult[0]) - 1 ; i >= 0; i--) {
02903                 c = seconds / mult[i];
02904 
02905                 if (c > 0 || (i == 0 && buf == tail))
02906                         tail += snprintf(tail, 40-(tail-buf), "%lu%c", c, spec[i]);
02907 
02908                 seconds %= mult[i];
02909         }
02910 
02911         return tail;
02912 }
02913 
02914 static void sec2str(time_t seconds, char *buf, int rc)
02915 {
02916         char *tail = buf;
02917 
02918         if (rc)
02919                 *tail++ = '[';
02920 
02921         tail = __sec2str(seconds, tail);
02922 
02923         if (rc && tail - buf < 39) {
02924                 *tail++ = ']';
02925                 *tail++ = 0;
02926         }
02927 }
02928 
02929 static void diff2str(time_t seconds, char *buf, time_t now)
02930 {
02931 
02932         buf[0] = 0;
02933         if (!seconds)
02934                 return;
02935         if (seconds <= now) {
02936                 strcpy(buf, "none");
02937                 return;
02938         }
02939         __sec2str(seconds - now, buf);
02940 }
02941 
02942 static void print_quota_title(char *name, struct if_quotactl *qctl,
02943                               bool human_readable)
02944 {
02945         printf("Disk quotas for %s %s (%cid %u):\n",
02946                type2name(qctl->qc_type), name,
02947                *type2name(qctl->qc_type), qctl->qc_id);
02948         printf("%15s%8s %7s%8s%8s%8s %7s%8s%8s\n",
02949                "Filesystem", human_readable ? "used" : "kbytes",
02950                "quota", "limit", "grace",
02951                "files", "quota", "limit", "grace");
02952 }
02953 
02954 static void kbytes2str(__u64 num, char *buf, int buflen, bool h)
02955 {
02956         if (!h) {
02957                 snprintf(buf, buflen, "%ju", (uintmax_t)num);
02958         } else {
02959                 if (num >> 40)
02960                         snprintf(buf, buflen, "%5.4gP",
02961                                  (double)num / ((__u64)1 << 40));
02962                 else if (num >> 30)
02963                         snprintf(buf, buflen, "%5.4gT",
02964                                  (double)num / (1 << 30));
02965                 else if (num >> 20)
02966                         snprintf(buf, buflen, "%5.4gG",
02967                                  (double)num / (1 << 20));
02968                 else if (num >> 10)
02969                         snprintf(buf, buflen, "%5.4gM",
02970                                  (double)num / (1 << 10));
02971                 else
02972                         snprintf(buf, buflen, "%ju%s", (uintmax_t)num, "k");
02973         }
02974 }
02975 
02976 #define STRBUF_LEN      32
02977 static void print_quota(char *mnt, struct if_quotactl *qctl, int type,
02978                         int rc, bool h)
02979 {
02980         time_t now;
02981 
02982         time(&now);
02983 
02984         if (qctl->qc_cmd == LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA || qctl->qc_cmd == Q_GETOQUOTA) {
02985                 int bover = 0, iover = 0;
02986                 struct obd_dqblk *dqb = &qctl->qc_dqblk;
02987                 char numbuf[3][STRBUF_LEN];
02988                 char timebuf[40];
02989                 char strbuf[STRBUF_LEN];
02990 
02991                 if (dqb->dqb_bhardlimit &&
02992                     lustre_stoqb(dqb->dqb_curspace) >= dqb->dqb_bhardlimit) {
02993                         bover = 1;
02994                 } else if (dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit && dqb->dqb_btime) {
02995                         if (dqb->dqb_btime > now) {
02996                                 bover = 2;
02997                         } else {
02998                                 bover = 3;
02999                         }
03000                 }
03001 
03002                 if (dqb->dqb_ihardlimit &&
03003                     dqb->dqb_curinodes >= dqb->dqb_ihardlimit) {
03004                         iover = 1;
03005                 } else if (dqb->dqb_isoftlimit && dqb->dqb_itime) {
03006                         if (dqb->dqb_itime > now) {
03007                                 iover = 2;
03008                         } else {
03009                                 iover = 3;
03010                         }
03011                 }
03012 
03013 
03014                 if (strlen(mnt) > 15)
03015                         printf("%s\n%15s", mnt, "");
03016                 else
03017                         printf("%15s", mnt);
03018 
03019                 if (bover)
03020                         diff2str(dqb->dqb_btime, timebuf, now);
03021 
03022                 kbytes2str(lustre_stoqb(dqb->dqb_curspace),
03023                            strbuf, sizeof(strbuf), h);
03024                 if (rc == -EREMOTEIO)
03025                         sprintf(numbuf[0], "%s*", strbuf);
03026                 else
03027                         sprintf(numbuf[0], (dqb->dqb_valid & QIF_SPACE) ?
03028                                 "%s" : "[%s]", strbuf);
03029 
03030                 kbytes2str(dqb->dqb_bsoftlimit, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf), h);
03031                 if (type == QC_GENERAL)
03032                         sprintf(numbuf[1], (dqb->dqb_valid & QIF_BLIMITS) ?
03033                                 "%s" : "[%s]", strbuf);
03034                 else
03035                         sprintf(numbuf[1], "%s", "-");
03036 
03037                 kbytes2str(dqb->dqb_bhardlimit, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf), h);
03038                 sprintf(numbuf[2], (dqb->dqb_valid & QIF_BLIMITS) ?
03039                         "%s" : "[%s]", strbuf);
03040 
03041                 printf(" %7s%c %6s %7s %7s",
03042                        numbuf[0], bover ? '*' : ' ', numbuf[1],
03043                        numbuf[2], bover > 1 ? timebuf : "-");
03044 
03045                 if (iover)
03046                         diff2str(dqb->dqb_itime, timebuf, now);
03047 
03048                 sprintf(numbuf[0], (dqb->dqb_valid & QIF_INODES) ?
03049                         "%ju" : "[%ju]", (uintmax_t)dqb->dqb_curinodes);
03050 
03051                 if (type == QC_GENERAL)
03052                         sprintf(numbuf[1], (dqb->dqb_valid & QIF_ILIMITS) ?
03053                                 "%ju" : "[%ju]",
03054                                 (uintmax_t)dqb->dqb_isoftlimit);
03055                 else
03056                         sprintf(numbuf[1], "%s", "-");
03057 
03058                 sprintf(numbuf[2], (dqb->dqb_valid & QIF_ILIMITS) ?
03059                         "%ju" : "[%ju]", (uintmax_t)dqb->dqb_ihardlimit);
03060 
03061                 if (type != QC_OSTIDX)
03062                         printf(" %7s%c %6s %7s %7s",
03063                                numbuf[0], iover ? '*' : ' ', numbuf[1],
03064                                numbuf[2], iover > 1 ? timebuf : "-");
03065                 else
03066                         printf(" %7s %7s %7s %7s", "-", "-", "-", "-");
03067                 printf("\n");
03068 
03069         } else if (qctl->qc_cmd == LUSTRE_Q_GETINFO ||
03070                    qctl->qc_cmd == Q_GETOINFO) {
03071                 char bgtimebuf[40];
03072                 char igtimebuf[40];
03073 
03074                 sec2str(qctl->qc_dqinfo.dqi_bgrace, bgtimebuf, rc);
03075                 sec2str(qctl->qc_dqinfo.dqi_igrace, igtimebuf, rc);
03076                 printf("Block grace time: %s; Inode grace time: %s\n",
03077                        bgtimebuf, igtimebuf);
03078         }
03079 }
03080 
03081 static int print_obd_quota(char *mnt, struct if_quotactl *qctl, int is_mdt,
03082                            bool h, __u64 *total)
03083 {
03084         int rc = 0, rc1 = 0, count = 0;
03085         __u32 valid = qctl->qc_valid;
03086 
03087         rc = llapi_get_obd_count(mnt, &count, is_mdt);
03088         if (rc) {
03089                 fprintf(stderr, "can not get %s count: %s\n",
03090                         is_mdt ? "mdt": "ost", strerror(-rc));
03091                 return rc;
03092         }
03093 
03094         for (qctl->qc_idx = 0; qctl->qc_idx < count; qctl->qc_idx++) {
03095                 qctl->qc_valid = is_mdt ? QC_MDTIDX : QC_OSTIDX;
03096                 rc = llapi_quotactl(mnt, qctl);
03097                 if (rc) {
03098                         /* It is remote client case. */
03099                         if (-rc == EOPNOTSUPP) {
03100                                 rc = 0;
03101                                 goto out;
03102                         }
03103 
03104                         if (!rc1)
03105                                 rc1 = rc;
03106                         fprintf(stderr, "quotactl %s%d failed.\n",
03107                                 is_mdt ? "mdt": "ost", qctl->qc_idx);
03108                         continue;
03109                 }
03110 
03111                 print_quota(obd_uuid2str(&qctl->obd_uuid), qctl,
03112                             qctl->qc_valid, 0, h);
03113                 *total += is_mdt ? qctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_ihardlimit :
03114                                    qctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_bhardlimit;
03115         }
03116 out:
03117         qctl->qc_valid = valid;
03118         return rc ? : rc1;
03119 }
03120 
03121 static int lfs_quota(int argc, char **argv)
03122 {
03123         int c;
03124         char *mnt, *name = NULL;
03125         struct if_quotactl qctl = { .qc_cmd = LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA,
03126                                     .qc_type = UGQUOTA };
03127         char *obd_type = (char *)qctl.obd_type;
03128         char *obd_uuid = (char *)qctl.obd_uuid.uuid;
03129         int rc, rc1 = 0, rc2 = 0, rc3 = 0,
03130             verbose = 0, pass = 0, quiet = 0, inacc;
03131         char *endptr;
03132         __u32 valid = QC_GENERAL, idx = 0;
03133         __u64 total_ialloc = 0, total_balloc = 0;
03134         bool human_readable = false;
03135 
03136         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "gi:I:o:qtuvh")) != -1) {
03137                 switch (c) {
03138                 case 'u':
03139                         if (qctl.qc_type != UGQUOTA) {
03140                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: use either -u or -g\n");
03141                                 return CMD_HELP;
03142                         }
03143                         qctl.qc_type = USRQUOTA;
03144                         break;
03145                 case 'g':
03146                         if (qctl.qc_type != UGQUOTA) {
03147                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: use either -u or -g\n");
03148                                 return CMD_HELP;
03149                         }
03150                         qctl.qc_type = GRPQUOTA;
03151                         break;
03152                 case 't':
03153                         qctl.qc_cmd = LUSTRE_Q_GETINFO;
03154                         break;
03155                 case 'o':
03156                         valid = qctl.qc_valid = QC_UUID;
03157                         strlcpy(obd_uuid, optarg, sizeof(qctl.obd_uuid));
03158                         break;
03159                 case 'i':
03160                         valid = qctl.qc_valid = QC_MDTIDX;
03161                         idx = qctl.qc_idx = atoi(optarg);
03162                         break;
03163                 case 'I':
03164                         valid = qctl.qc_valid = QC_OSTIDX;
03165                         idx = qctl.qc_idx = atoi(optarg);
03166                         break;
03167                 case 'v':
03168                         verbose = 1;
03169                         break;
03170                 case 'q':
03171                         quiet = 1;
03172                         break;
03173                 case 'h':
03174                         human_readable = true;
03175                         break;
03176                 default:
03177                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '-%c' "
03178                                         "unrecognized\n", argv[0], c);
03179                         return CMD_HELP;
03180                 }
03181         }
03182 
03183         /* current uid/gid info for "lfs quota /path/to/lustre/mount" */
03184         if (qctl.qc_cmd == LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA && qctl.qc_type == UGQUOTA &&
03185             optind == argc - 1) {
03186 ug_output:
03187                 memset(&qctl, 0, sizeof(qctl)); /* spoiled by print_*_quota */
03188                 qctl.qc_cmd = LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA;
03189                 qctl.qc_valid = valid;
03190                 qctl.qc_idx = idx;
03191                 if (pass++ == 0) {
03192                         qctl.qc_type = USRQUOTA;
03193                         qctl.qc_id = geteuid();
03194                 } else {
03195                         qctl.qc_type = GRPQUOTA;
03196                         qctl.qc_id = getegid();
03197                 }
03198                 rc = id2name(&name, qctl.qc_id,
03199                              (qctl.qc_type == USRQUOTA) ? USER : GROUP);
03200                 if (rc)
03201                         name = "<unknown>";
03202         /* lfs quota -u username /path/to/lustre/mount */
03203         } else if (qctl.qc_cmd == LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA) {
03204                 /* options should be followed by u/g-name and mntpoint */
03205                 if (optind + 2 != argc || qctl.qc_type == UGQUOTA) {
03206                         fprintf(stderr, "error: missing quota argument(s)\n");
03207                         return CMD_HELP;
03208                 }
03209 
03210                 name = argv[optind++];
03211                 rc = name2id(&qctl.qc_id, name,
03212                              (qctl.qc_type == USRQUOTA) ? USER : GROUP);
03213                 if (rc) {
03214                         qctl.qc_id = strtoul(name, &endptr, 10);
03215                         if (*endptr != '\0') {
03216                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: can't find id for name "
03217                                         "%s\n", name);
03218                                 return CMD_HELP;
03219                         }
03220                 }
03221         } else if (optind + 1 != argc || qctl.qc_type == UGQUOTA) {
03222                 fprintf(stderr, "error: missing quota info argument(s)\n");
03223                 return CMD_HELP;
03224         }
03225 
03226         mnt = argv[optind];
03227 
03228         rc1 = llapi_quotactl(mnt, &qctl);
03229         if (rc1 < 0) {
03230                 switch (rc1) {
03231                 case -ESRCH:
03232                         fprintf(stderr, "%s quotas are not enabled.\n",
03233                                 qctl.qc_type == USRQUOTA ? "user" : "group");
03234                         goto out;
03235                 case -EPERM:
03236                         fprintf(stderr, "Permission denied.\n");
03237                 case -ENOENT:
03238                         /* We already got a "No such file..." message. */
03239                         goto out;
03240                 default:
03241                         fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected quotactl error: %s\n",
03242                                 strerror(-rc1));
03243                 }
03244         }
03245 
03246         if (qctl.qc_cmd == LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA && !quiet)
03247                 print_quota_title(name, &qctl, human_readable);
03248 
03249         if (rc1 && *obd_type)
03250                 fprintf(stderr, "%s %s ", obd_type, obd_uuid);
03251 
03252         if (qctl.qc_valid != QC_GENERAL)
03253                 mnt = "";
03254 
03255         inacc = (qctl.qc_cmd == LUSTRE_Q_GETQUOTA) &&
03256                 ((qctl.qc_dqblk.dqb_valid & (QIF_LIMITS|QIF_USAGE)) !=
03257                  (QIF_LIMITS|QIF_USAGE));
03258 
03259         print_quota(mnt, &qctl, QC_GENERAL, rc1, human_readable);
03260 
03261         if (qctl.qc_valid == QC_GENERAL && qctl.qc_cmd != LUSTRE_Q_GETINFO &&
03262             verbose) {
03263                 char strbuf[STRBUF_LEN];
03264 
03265                 rc2 = print_obd_quota(mnt, &qctl, 1, human_readable,
03266                                       &total_ialloc);
03267                 rc3 = print_obd_quota(mnt, &qctl, 0, human_readable,
03268                                       &total_balloc);
03269                 kbytes2str(total_balloc, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf),
03270                            human_readable);
03271                 printf("Total allocated inode limit: %ju, total "
03272                        "allocated block limit: %s\n", (uintmax_t)total_ialloc,
03273                        strbuf);
03274         }
03275 
03276         if (rc1 || rc2 || rc3 || inacc)
03277                 printf("Some errors happened when getting quota info. "
03278                        "Some devices may be not working or deactivated. "
03279                        "The data in \"[]\" is inaccurate.\n");
03280 
03281 out:
03282         if (pass == 1)
03283                 goto ug_output;
03284 
03285         return rc1;
03286 }
03287 #endif /* HAVE_SYS_QUOTA_H! */
03288 
03289 static int flushctx_ioctl(char *mp)
03290 {
03291         int fd, rc;
03292 
03293         fd = open(mp, O_RDONLY);
03294         if (fd == -1) {
03295                 fprintf(stderr, "flushctx: error open %s: %s\n",
03296                         mp, strerror(errno));
03297                 return -1;
03298         }
03299 
03300         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_FLUSHCTX);
03301         if (rc == -1)
03302                 fprintf(stderr, "flushctx: error ioctl %s: %s\n",
03303                         mp, strerror(errno));
03304 
03305         close(fd);
03306         return rc;
03307 }
03308 
03309 static int lfs_flushctx(int argc, char **argv)
03310 {
03311         int     kdestroy = 0, c;
03312         char    mntdir[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'};
03313         int     index = 0;
03314         int     rc = 0;
03315 
03316         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "k")) != -1) {
03317                 switch (c) {
03318                 case 'k':
03319                         kdestroy = 1;
03320                         break;
03321                 default:
03322                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '-%c' "
03323                                         "unrecognized\n", argv[0], c);
03324                         return CMD_HELP;
03325                 }
03326         }
03327 
03328         if (kdestroy) {
03329             if ((rc = system("kdestroy > /dev/null")) != 0) {
03330                 rc = WEXITSTATUS(rc);
03331                 fprintf(stderr, "error destroying tickets: %d, continuing\n", rc);
03332             }
03333         }
03334 
03335         if (optind >= argc) {
03336                 /* flush for all mounted lustre fs. */
03337                 while (!llapi_search_mounts(NULL, index++, mntdir, NULL)) {
03338                         /* Check if we have a mount point */
03339                         if (mntdir[0] == '\0')
03340                                 continue;
03341 
03342                         if (flushctx_ioctl(mntdir))
03343                                 rc = -1;
03344 
03345                         mntdir[0] = '\0'; /* avoid matching in next loop */
03346                 }
03347         } else {
03348                 /* flush fs as specified */
03349                 while (optind < argc) {
03350                         if (flushctx_ioctl(argv[optind++]))
03351                                 rc = -1;
03352                 }
03353         }
03354         return rc;
03355 }
03356

03358 {
03359         argv[0]++;
03360         return(llapi_lsetfacl(argc, argv));
03361 }

03378         return(llapi_rgetfacl(argc, argv));
03379 }
