03390 
03391 static int lfs_changelog(int argc, char **argv)
03392 {
03393         void *changelog_priv;
03394         struct changelog_rec *rec;
03395         long long startrec = 0, endrec = 0;
03396         char *mdd;
03397         struct option long_opts[] = {
03398                 {"follow", no_argument, 0, 'f'},
03399                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
03400         };
03401         char short_opts[] = "f";
03402         int rc, follow = 0;
03403 
03404         while ((rc = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_opts,
03405                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
03406                 switch (rc) {
03407                 case 'f':
03408                         follow++;
03409                         break;
03410                 case '?':
03411                         return CMD_HELP;
03412                 default:
03413                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
03414                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
03415                         return CMD_HELP;
03416                 }
03417         }
03418         if (optind >= argc)
03419                 return CMD_HELP;
03420 
03421         mdd = argv[optind++];
03422         if (argc > optind)
03423                 startrec = strtoll(argv[optind++], NULL, 10);
03424         if (argc > optind)
03425                 endrec = strtoll(argv[optind++], NULL, 10);
03426 
03427         rc = llapi_changelog_start(&changelog_priv,
03428                                    CHANGELOG_FLAG_BLOCK |
03429                                    CHANGELOG_FLAG_JOBID |
03430                                    (follow ? CHANGELOG_FLAG_FOLLOW : 0),
03431                                    mdd, startrec);
03432         if (rc < 0) {
03433                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't start changelog: %s\n",
03434                         strerror(errno = -rc));
03435                 return rc;
03436         }
03437 
03438         while ((rc = llapi_changelog_recv(changelog_priv, &rec)) == 0) {
03439                 time_t secs;
03440                 struct tm ts;
03441 
03442                 if (endrec && rec->cr_index > endrec) {
03443                         llapi_changelog_free(&rec);
03444                         break;
03445                 }
03446                 if (rec->cr_index < startrec) {
03447                         llapi_changelog_free(&rec);
03448                         continue;
03449                 }
03450 
03451                 secs = rec->cr_time >> 30;
03452                 gmtime_r(&secs, &ts);
03453                 printf("%ju %02d%-5s %02d:%02d:%02d.%06d %04d.%02d.%02d "
03454                        "0x%x t="DFID, (uintmax_t) rec->cr_index, rec->cr_type,
03455                        changelog_type2str(rec->cr_type),
03456                        ts.tm_hour, ts.tm_min, ts.tm_sec,
03457                        (int)(rec->cr_time & ((1<<30) - 1)),
03458                        ts.tm_year + 1900, ts.tm_mon + 1, ts.tm_mday,
03459                        rec->cr_flags & CLF_FLAGMASK, PFID(&rec->cr_tfid));
03460 
03461                 if (rec->cr_flags & CLF_JOBID) {
03462                         struct changelog_ext_jobid *jid =
03463                                 changelog_rec_jobid(rec);
03464 
03465                         if (jid->cr_jobid[0] != '\0')
03466                                 printf(" j=%s", jid->cr_jobid);
03467                 }
03468 
03469                 if (rec->cr_namelen)
03470                         printf(" p="DFID" %.*s", PFID(&rec->cr_pfid),
03471                                rec->cr_namelen, changelog_rec_name(rec));
03472 
03473                 if (rec->cr_flags & CLF_RENAME) {
03474                         struct changelog_ext_rename *rnm =
03475                                 changelog_rec_rename(rec);
03476 
03477                         if (!fid_is_zero(&rnm->cr_sfid))
03478                                 printf(" s="DFID" sp="DFID" %.*s",
03479                                        PFID(&rnm->cr_sfid),
03480                                        PFID(&rnm->cr_spfid),
03481                                        (int)changelog_rec_snamelen(rec),
03482                                        changelog_rec_sname(rec));
03483                 }
03484                 printf("\n");
03485 
03486                 llapi_changelog_free(&rec);
03487         }
03488 
03489         llapi_changelog_fini(&changelog_priv);
03490 
03491         if (rc < 0)
03492                 fprintf(stderr, "Changelog: %s\n", strerror(errno = -rc));
03493 
03494         return (rc == 1 ? 0 : rc);
03495 }
03496 
03497 static int lfs_changelog_clear(int argc, char **argv)
03498 {
03499         long long endrec;
03500         int rc;
03501 
03502         if (argc != 4)
03503                 return CMD_HELP;
03504 
03505         endrec = strtoll(argv[3], NULL, 10);
03506 
03507         rc = llapi_changelog_clear(argv[1], argv[2], endrec);
03508         if (rc)
03509                 fprintf(stderr, "%s error: %s\n", argv[0],
03510                         strerror(errno = -rc));
03511         return rc;
03512 }
03513 
03514 static int lfs_fid2path(int argc, char **argv)
03515 {
03516         struct option long_opts[] = {
03517                 {"cur", no_argument, 0, 'c'},
03518                 {"link", required_argument, 0, 'l'},
03519                 {"rec", required_argument, 0, 'r'},
03520                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
03521         };
03522         char  short_opts[] = "cl:r:";
03523         char *device, *fid, *path;
03524         long long recno = -1;
03525         int linkno = -1;
03526         int lnktmp;
03527         int printcur = 0;
03528         int rc = 0;
03529 
03530         while ((rc = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_opts,
03531                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
03532                 switch (rc) {
03533                 case 'c':
03534                         printcur++;
03535                         break;
03536                 case 'l':
03537                         linkno = strtol(optarg, NULL, 10);
03538                         break;
03539                 case 'r':
03540                         recno = strtoll(optarg, NULL, 10);
03541                         break;
03542                 case '?':
03543                         return CMD_HELP;
03544                 default:
03545                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
03546                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
03547                         return CMD_HELP;
03548                 }
03549         }
03550 
03551         if (argc < 3)
03552                 return CMD_HELP;
03553 
03554         device = argv[optind++];
03555         path = calloc(1, PATH_MAX);
03556         if (path == NULL) {
03557                 fprintf(stderr, "error: Not enough memory\n");
03558                 return -errno;
03559         }
03560 
03561         rc = 0;
03562         while (optind < argc) {
03563                 fid = argv[optind++];
03564 
03565                 lnktmp = (linkno >= 0) ? linkno : 0;
03566                 while (1) {
03567                         int oldtmp = lnktmp;
03568                         long long rectmp = recno;
03569                         int rc2;
03570                         rc2 = llapi_fid2path(device, fid, path, PATH_MAX,
03571                                              &rectmp, &lnktmp);
03572                         if (rc2 < 0) {
03573                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: error on FID %s: %s\n",
03574                                         argv[0], fid, strerror(errno = -rc2));
03575                                 if (rc == 0)
03576                                         rc = rc2;
03577                                 break;
03578                         }
03579 
03580                         if (printcur)
03581                                 fprintf(stdout, "%lld ", rectmp);
03582                         if (device[0] == '/') {
03583                                 fprintf(stdout, "%s", device);
03584                                 if (device[strlen(device) - 1] != '/')
03585                                         fprintf(stdout, "/");
03586                         } else if (path[0] == '\0') {
03587                                 fprintf(stdout, "/");
03588                         }
03589                         fprintf(stdout, "%s\n", path);
03590 
03591                         if (linkno >= 0)
03592                                 /* specified linkno */
03593                                 break;
03594                         if (oldtmp == lnktmp)
03595                                 /* no more links */
03596                                 break;
03597                 }
03598         }
03599 
03600         free(path);
03601         return rc;
03602 }
03603 
03604 static int lfs_path2fid(int argc, char **argv)
03605 {
03606         struct option     long_opts[] = {
03607                 {"parents", no_argument, 0, 'p'},
03608                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
03609         };
03610         char            **path;
03611         const char        short_opts[] = "p";
03612         const char       *sep = "";
03613         lustre_fid        fid;
03614         int               rc = 0;
03615         bool              show_parents = false;
03616 
03617         while ((rc = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_opts,
03618                                  long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
03619                 switch (rc) {
03620                 case 'p':
03621                         show_parents = true;
03622                         break;
03623                 default:
03624                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
03625                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
03626                         return CMD_HELP;
03627                 }
03628         }
03629 
03630         if (optind > argc - 1)
03631                 return CMD_HELP;
03632         else if (optind < argc - 1)
03633                 sep = ": ";
03634 
03635         rc = 0;
03636         for (path = argv + optind; *path != NULL; path++) {
03637                 int err = 0;
03638                 if (!show_parents) {
03639                         err = llapi_path2fid(*path, &fid);
03640                         if (!err)
03641                                 printf("%s%s"DFID"\n",
03642                                        *sep != '\0' ? *path : "", sep,
03643                                        PFID(&fid));
03644                 } else {
03645                         char            name[NAME_MAX + 1];
03646                         unsigned int    linkno = 0;
03647 
03648                         while ((err = llapi_path2parent(*path, linkno, &fid,
03649                                                 name, sizeof(name))) == 0) {
03650                                 if (*sep != '\0' && linkno == 0)
03651                                         printf("%s%s", *path, sep);
03652 
03653                                 printf("%s"DFID"/%s", linkno != 0 ? "\t" : "",
03654                                        PFID(&fid), name);
03655                                 linkno++;
03656                         }
03657 
03658                         /* err == -ENODATA is end-of-loop */
03659                         if (linkno > 0 && err == -ENODATA) {
03660                                 printf("\n");
03661                                 err = 0;
03662                         }
03663                 }
03664 
03665                 if (err) {
03666                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: can't get %sfid for %s: %s\n",
03667                                 argv[0], show_parents ? "parent " : "", *path,
03668                                 strerror(-err));
03669                         if (rc == 0) {
03670                                 rc = err;
03671                                 errno = -err;
03672                         }
03673                 }
03674         }
03675 
03676         return rc;
03677 }
03678 
03679 static int lfs_data_version(int argc, char **argv)
03680 {
03681         char *path;
03682         __u64 data_version;
03683         int fd;
03684         int rc;
03685         int c;
03686         int data_version_flags = LL_DV_RD_FLUSH; /* Read by default */
03687 
03688         if (argc < 2)
03689                 return CMD_HELP;
03690 
03691         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "nrw")) != -1) {
03692                 switch (c) {
03693                 case 'n':
03694                         data_version_flags = 0;
03695                         break;
03696                 case 'r':
03697                         data_version_flags |= LL_DV_RD_FLUSH;
03698                         break;
03699                 case 'w':
03700                         data_version_flags |= LL_DV_WR_FLUSH;
03701                         break;
03702                 default:
03703                         return CMD_HELP;
03704                 }
03705         }
03706         if (optind == argc)
03707                 return CMD_HELP;
03708 
03709         path = argv[optind];
03710         fd = open(path, O_RDONLY);
03711         if (fd < 0)
03712                 err(errno, "cannot open file %s", path);
03713 
03714         rc = llapi_get_data_version(fd, &data_version, data_version_flags);
03715         if (rc < 0)
03716                 err(errno, "cannot get version for %s", path);
03717         else
03718                 printf("%ju" "\n", (uintmax_t)data_version);
03719 
03720         close(fd);
03721         return rc;
03722 }
03723 
03724 static int lfs_hsm_state(int argc, char **argv)
03725 {
03726         int rc;
03727         int i = 1;
03728         char *path;
03729         struct hsm_user_state hus;
03730 
03731         if (argc < 2)
03732                 return CMD_HELP;
03733 
03734         do {
03735                 path = argv[i];
03736 
03737                 rc = llapi_hsm_state_get(path, &hus);
03738                 if (rc) {
03739                         fprintf(stderr, "can't get hsm state for %s: %s\n",
03740                                 path, strerror(errno = -rc));
03741                         return rc;
03742                 }
03743 
03744                 /* Display path name and status flags */
03745                 printf("%s: (0x%08x)", path, hus.hus_states);
03746 
03747                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_RELEASED)
03748                         printf(" released");
03749                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_EXISTS)
03750                         printf(" exists");
03751                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_DIRTY)
03752                         printf(" dirty");
03753                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_ARCHIVED)
03754                         printf(" archived");
03755                 /* Display user-settable flags */
03756                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_NORELEASE)
03757                         printf(" never_release");
03758                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_NOARCHIVE)
03759                         printf(" never_archive");
03760                 if (hus.hus_states & HS_LOST)
03761                         printf(" lost_from_hsm");
03762 
03763                 if (hus.hus_archive_id != 0)
03764                         printf(", archive_id:%d", hus.hus_archive_id);
03765                 printf("\n");
03766 
03767         } while (++i < argc);
03768 
03769         return 0;
03770 }
03771 
03772 #define LFS_HSM_SET   0
03773 #define LFS_HSM_CLEAR 1
03774 
03781 static int lfs_hsm_change_flags(int argc, char **argv, int mode)
03782 {
03783         struct option long_opts[] = {
03784                 {"lost", 0, 0, 'l'},
03785                 {"norelease", 0, 0, 'r'},
03786                 {"noarchive", 0, 0, 'a'},
03787                 {"archived", 0, 0, 'A'},
03788                 {"dirty", 0, 0, 'd'},
03789                 {"exists", 0, 0, 'e'},
03790                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
03791         };
03792         char short_opts[] = "lraAde";
03793         __u64 mask = 0;
03794         int c, rc;
03795         char *path;
03796 
03797         if (argc < 3)
03798                 return CMD_HELP;
03799 
03800         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_opts,
03801                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
03802                 switch (c) {
03803                 case 'l':
03804                         mask |= HS_LOST;
03805                         break;
03806                 case 'a':
03807                         mask |= HS_NOARCHIVE;
03808                         break;
03809                 case 'A':
03810                         mask |= HS_ARCHIVED;
03811                         break;
03812                 case 'r':
03813                         mask |= HS_NORELEASE;
03814                         break;
03815                 case 'd':
03816                         mask |= HS_DIRTY;
03817                         break;
03818                 case 'e':
03819                         mask |= HS_EXISTS;
03820                         break;
03821                 case '?':
03822                         return CMD_HELP;
03823                 default:
03824                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
03825                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
03826                         return CMD_HELP;
03827                 }
03828         }
03829 
03830         /* User should have specified a flag */
03831         if (mask == 0)
03832                 return CMD_HELP;
03833 
03834         while (optind < argc) {
03835 
03836                 path = argv[optind];
03837 
03838                 /* If mode == 0, this means we apply the mask. */
03839                 if (mode == LFS_HSM_SET)
03840                         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set(path, mask, 0, 0);
03841                 else
03842                         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set(path, 0, mask, 0);
03843 
03844                 if (rc != 0) {
03845                         fprintf(stderr, "Can't change hsm flags for %s: %s\n",
03846                                 path, strerror(errno = -rc));
03847                         return rc;
03848                 }
03849                 optind++;
03850         }
03851 
03852         return 0;
03853 }
03854 
03855 static int lfs_hsm_action(int argc, char **argv)
03856 {
03857         int                              rc;
03858         int                              i = 1;
03859         char                            *path;
03860         struct hsm_current_action        hca;
03861         struct hsm_extent                he;
03862         enum hsm_user_action             hua;
03863         enum hsm_progress_states         hps;
03864 
03865         if (argc < 2)
03866                 return CMD_HELP;
03867 
03868         do {
03869                 path = argv[i];
03870 
03871                 rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(path, &hca);
03872                 if (rc) {
03873                         fprintf(stderr, "can't get hsm action for %s: %s\n",
03874                                 path, strerror(errno = -rc));
03875                         return rc;
03876                 }
03877                 he = hca.hca_location;
03878                 hua = hca.hca_action;
03879                 hps = hca.hca_state;
03880 
03881                 printf("%s: %s", path, hsm_user_action2name(hua));
03882 
03883                 /* Skip file without action */
03884                 if (hca.hca_action == HUA_NONE) {
03885                         printf("\n");
03886                         continue;
03887                 }
03888 
03889                 printf(" %s ", hsm_progress_state2name(hps));
03890 
03891                 if ((hps == HPS_RUNNING) &&
03892                     (hua == HUA_ARCHIVE || hua == HUA_RESTORE))
03893                         printf("(%llu bytes moved)\n",
03894                                (unsigned long long)he.length);
03895                 else if ((he.offset + he.length) == LUSTRE_EOF)
03896                         printf("(from %llu to EOF)\n",
03897                                (unsigned long long)he.offset);
03898                 else
03899                         printf("(from %llu to %llu)\n",
03900                                (unsigned long long)he.offset,
03901                                (unsigned long long)(he.offset + he.length));
03902 
03903         } while (++i < argc);
03904 
03905         return 0;
03906 }
03907 
03908 static int lfs_hsm_set(int argc, char **argv)
03909 {
03910         return lfs_hsm_change_flags(argc, argv, LFS_HSM_SET);
03911 }
03912 
03913 static int lfs_hsm_clear(int argc, char **argv)
03914 {
03915         return lfs_hsm_change_flags(argc, argv, LFS_HSM_CLEAR);
03916 }
03917 
03927 static int lfs_hsm_prepare_file(const char *file, struct lu_fid *fid,
03928                                 dev_t *last_dev)
03929 {
03930         struct stat     st;
03931         int             rc;
03932 
03933         rc = lstat(file, &st);
03934         if (rc) {
03935                 fprintf(stderr, "Cannot stat %s: %s\n", file, strerror(errno));
03936                 return -errno;
03937         }
03938         /* Checking for regular file as archiving as posix copytool
03939          * rejects archiving files other than regular files
03940          */
03941         if (!S_ISREG(st.st_mode)) {
03942                 fprintf(stderr, "error: \"%s\" is not a regular file\n", file);
03943                 return CMD_HELP;
03944         }
03945         /* A request should be ... */
03946         if (*last_dev != st.st_dev && *last_dev != 0) {
03947                 fprintf(stderr, "All files should be "
03948                         "on the same filesystem: %s\n", file);
03949                 return -EINVAL;
03950         }
03951         *last_dev = st.st_dev;
03952 
03953         rc = llapi_path2fid(file, fid);
03954         if (rc) {
03955                 fprintf(stderr, "Cannot read FID of %s: %s\n",
03956                         file, strerror(-rc));
03957                 return rc;
03958         }
03959         return 0;
03960 }
03961 
03962 /* Fill an HSM HUR item with a given file name.
03963  *
03964  * If mntpath is set, then the filename is actually a FID, and no
03965  * lookup on the filesystem will be performed.
03966  *
03967  * \param[in]  hur         the user request to fill
03968  * \param[in]  idx         index of the item inside the HUR to fill
03969  * \param[in]  mntpath     mountpoint of Lustre
03970  * \param[in]  fname       filename (if mtnpath is NULL)
03971  *                         or FID (if mntpath is set)
03972  * \param[in]  last_dev    pointer to last device id used
03973  *
03974  * \retval 0 on success
03975  * \retval CMD_HELP or a negative errno on error
03976  */
03977 static int fill_hur_item(struct hsm_user_request *hur, unsigned int idx,
03978                          const char *mntpath, const char *fname,
03979                          dev_t *last_dev)
03980 {
03981         struct hsm_user_item *hui = &hur->hur_user_item[idx];
03982         int rc;
03983 
03984         hui->hui_extent.length = -1;
03985 
03986         if (mntpath != NULL) {
03987                 if (*fname == '[')
03988                         fname++;
03989                 rc = sscanf(fname, SFID, RFID(&hui->hui_fid));
03990                 if (rc == 3) {
03991                         rc = 0;
03992                 } else {
03993                         fprintf(stderr, "hsm: '%s' is not a valid FID\n",
03994                                 fname);
03995                         rc = -EINVAL;
03996                 }
03997         } else {
03998                 rc = lfs_hsm_prepare_file(fname, &hui->hui_fid, last_dev);
03999         }
04000 
04001         if (rc == 0)
04002                 hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount++;
04003 
04004         return rc;
04005 }
04006 
04007 static int lfs_hsm_request(int argc, char **argv, int action)
04008 {
04009         struct option            long_opts[] = {
04010                 {"filelist", 1, 0, 'l'},
04011                 {"data", 1, 0, 'D'},
04012                 {"archive", 1, 0, 'a'},
04013                 {"mntpath", 1, 0, 'm'},
04014                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
04015         };
04016         dev_t                    last_dev = 0;
04017         char                     short_opts[] = "l:D:a:m:";
04018         struct hsm_user_request *hur, *oldhur;
04019         int                      c, i;
04020         size_t                   len;
04021         int                      nbfile;
04022         char                    *line = NULL;
04023         char                    *filelist = NULL;
04024         char                     fullpath[PATH_MAX];
04025         char                    *opaque = NULL;
04026         int                      opaque_len = 0;
04027         int                      archive_id = 0;
04028         FILE                    *fp;
04029         int                      nbfile_alloc = 0;
04030         char                    *some_file = NULL;
04031         char                    *mntpath = NULL;
04032         int                      rc;
04033 
04034         if (argc < 2)
04035                 return CMD_HELP;
04036 
04037         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_opts,
04038                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
04039                 switch (c) {
04040                 case 'l':
04041                         filelist = optarg;
04042                         break;
04043                 case 'D':
04044                         opaque = optarg;
04045                         break;
04046                 case 'a':
04047                         if (action != HUA_ARCHIVE &&
04048                             action != HUA_REMOVE) {
04049                                 fprintf(stderr,
04050                                         "error: -a is supported only "
04051                                         "when archiving or removing\n");
04052                                 return CMD_HELP;
04053                         }
04054                         archive_id = atoi(optarg);
04055                         break;
04056                 case 'm':
04057                         if (some_file == NULL) {
04058                                 mntpath = optarg;
04059                                 some_file = strdup(optarg);
04060                         }
04061                         break;
04062                 case '?':
04063                         return CMD_HELP;
04064                 default:
04065                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
04066                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
04067                         return CMD_HELP;
04068                 }
04069         }
04070 
04071         /* All remaining args are files, so we have at least nbfile */
04072         nbfile = argc - optind;
04073 
04074         if ((nbfile == 0) && (filelist == NULL))
04075                 return CMD_HELP;
04076 
04077         if (opaque != NULL)
04078                 opaque_len = strlen(opaque);
04079 
04080         /* Alloc the request structure with enough place to store all files
04081          * from command line. */
04082         hur = llapi_hsm_user_request_alloc(nbfile, opaque_len);
04083         if (hur == NULL) {
04084                 fprintf(stderr, "Cannot create the request: %s\n",
04085                         strerror(errno));
04086                 return errno;
04087         }
04088         nbfile_alloc = nbfile;
04089 
04090         hur->hur_request.hr_action = action;
04091         hur->hur_request.hr_archive_id = archive_id;
04092         hur->hur_request.hr_flags = 0;
04093 
04094         /* All remaining args are files, add them */
04095         if (nbfile != 0 && some_file == NULL)
04096                 some_file = strdup(argv[optind]);
04097 
04098         for (i = 0; i < nbfile; i++) {
04099                 rc = fill_hur_item(hur, i, mntpath, argv[optind + i],
04100                                    &last_dev);
04101                 if (rc)
04102                         goto out_free;
04103         }
04104 
04105         /* from here stop using nb_file, use hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount */
04106 
04107         /* If a filelist was specified, read the filelist from it. */
04108         if (filelist != NULL) {
04109                 fp = fopen(filelist, "r");
04110                 if (fp == NULL) {
04111                         fprintf(stderr, "Cannot read the file list %s: %s\n",
04112                                 filelist, strerror(errno));
04113                         rc = -errno;
04114                         goto out_free;
04115                 }
04116 
04117                 while ((rc = getline(&line, &len, fp)) != -1) {
04118                         /* If allocated buffer was too small, get something
04119                          * larger */
04120                         if (nbfile_alloc <= hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount) {
04121                                 ssize_t size;
04122 
04123                                 nbfile_alloc = nbfile_alloc * 2 + 1;
04124                                 oldhur = hur;
04125                                 hur = llapi_hsm_user_request_alloc(nbfile_alloc,
04126                                                                    opaque_len);
04127                                 if (hur == NULL) {
04128                                         fprintf(stderr, "hsm: cannot allocate "
04129                                                 "the request: %s\n",
04130                                                 strerror(errno));
04131                                         hur = oldhur;
04132                                         rc = -errno;
04133                                         fclose(fp);
04134                                         goto out_free;
04135                                 }
04136                                 size = hur_len(oldhur);
04137                                 if (size < 0) {
04138                                         fprintf(stderr, "hsm: cannot allocate "
04139                                                 "%u files + %u bytes data\n",
04140                                             oldhur->hur_request.hr_itemcount,
04141                                             oldhur->hur_request.hr_data_len);
04142                                         free(hur);
04143                                         hur = oldhur;
04144                                         rc = -E2BIG;
04145                                         fclose(fp);
04146                                         goto out_free;
04147                                 }
04148                                 memcpy(hur, oldhur, size);
04149                                 free(oldhur);
04150                         }
04151 
04152                         /* Chop CR */
04153                         if (line[strlen(line) - 1] == '\n')
04154                                 line[strlen(line) - 1] = '\0';
04155 
04156                         rc = fill_hur_item(hur, hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount,
04157                                            mntpath, line, &last_dev);
04158                         if (rc) {
04159                                 fclose(fp);
04160                                 goto out_free;
04161                         }
04162 
04163                         if (some_file == NULL) {
04164                                 some_file = line;
04165                                 line = NULL;
04166                         }
04167                 }
04168 
04169                 rc = fclose(fp);
04170                 free(line);
04171         }
04172 
04173         /* If a --data was used, add it to the request */
04174         hur->hur_request.hr_data_len = opaque_len;
04175         if (opaque != NULL)
04176                 memcpy(hur_data(hur), opaque, opaque_len);
04177 
04178         /* Send the HSM request */
04179         if (realpath(some_file, fullpath) == NULL) {
04180                 fprintf(stderr, "Could not find path '%s': %s\n",
04181                         some_file, strerror(errno));
04182         }
04183         rc = llapi_hsm_request(fullpath, hur);
04184         if (rc) {
04185                 fprintf(stderr, "Cannot send HSM request (use of %s): %s\n",
04186                         some_file, strerror(-rc));
04187                 goto out_free;
04188         }
04189 
04190 out_free:
04191         free(some_file);
04192         free(hur);
04193         return rc;
04194 }
04195 
04196 static int lfs_hsm_archive(int argc, char **argv)
04197 {
04198         return lfs_hsm_request(argc, argv, HUA_ARCHIVE);
04199 }
04200 
04201 static int lfs_hsm_restore(int argc, char **argv)
04202 {
04203         return lfs_hsm_request(argc, argv, HUA_RESTORE);
04204 }
04205 
04206 static int lfs_hsm_release(int argc, char **argv)
04207 {
04208         return lfs_hsm_request(argc, argv, HUA_RELEASE);
04209 }
04210 
04211 static int lfs_hsm_remove(int argc, char **argv)
04212 {
04213         return lfs_hsm_request(argc, argv, HUA_REMOVE);
04214 }
04215 
04216 static int lfs_hsm_cancel(int argc, char **argv)
04217 {
04218         return lfs_hsm_request(argc, argv, HUA_CANCEL);
04219 }
04220 
04221 static int lfs_swap_layouts(int argc, char **argv)
04222 {
04223         if (argc != 3)
04224                 return CMD_HELP;
04225 
04226         return llapi_swap_layouts(argv[1], argv[2], 0, 0,
04227                                   SWAP_LAYOUTS_KEEP_MTIME |
04228                                   SWAP_LAYOUTS_KEEP_ATIME);
04229 }
04230 
04231 static const char *const ladvise_names[] = LU_LADVISE_NAMES;
04232 
04233 static enum lu_ladvise_type lfs_get_ladvice(const char *string)
04234 {
04235         enum lu_ladvise_type advice;
04236 
04237         for (advice = 0;
04238              advice < ARRAY_SIZE(ladvise_names); advice++) {
04239                 if (ladvise_names[advice] == NULL)
04240                         continue;
04241                 if (strcmp(string, ladvise_names[advice]) == 0)
04242                         return advice;
04243         }
04244 
04245         return LU_LADVISE_INVALID;
04246 }
04247 
04248 static int lfs_ladvise(int argc, char **argv)
04249 {
04250         struct option            long_opts[] = {
04251                 {"advice",      required_argument,      0, 'a'},
04252                 {"background",  no_argument,            0, 'b'},
04253                 {"end",         required_argument,      0, 'e'},
04254                 {"start",       required_argument,      0, 's'},
04255                 {"length",      required_argument,      0, 'l'},
04256                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
04257         };
04258         char                     short_opts[] = "a:be:l:s:";
04259         int                      c;
04260         int                      rc = 0;
04261         const char              *path;
04262         int                      fd;
04263         struct lu_ladvise        advice;
04264         enum lu_ladvise_type     advice_type = LU_LADVISE_INVALID;
04265         unsigned long long       start = 0;
04266         unsigned long long       end = LUSTRE_EOF;
04267         unsigned long long       length = 0;
04268         unsigned long long       size_units;
04269         unsigned long long       flags = 0;
04270 
04271         optind = 0;
04272         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_opts,
04273                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
04274                 switch (c) {
04275                 case 'a':
04276                         advice_type = lfs_get_ladvice(optarg);
04277                         if (advice_type == LU_LADVISE_INVALID) {
04278                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: invalid advice type "
04279                                         "'%s'\n", argv[0], optarg);
04280                                 fprintf(stderr, "Valid types:");
04281 
04282                                 for (advice_type = 0;
04283                                      advice_type < ARRAY_SIZE(ladvise_names);
04284                                      advice_type++) {
04285                                         if (ladvise_names[advice_type] == NULL)
04286                                                 continue;
04287                                         fprintf(stderr, " %s",
04288                                                 ladvise_names[advice_type]);
04289                                 }
04290                                 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
04291 
04292                                 return CMD_HELP;
04293                         }
04294                         break;
04295                 case 'b':
04296                         flags |= LF_ASYNC;
04297                         break;
04298                 case 'e':
04299                         size_units = 1;
04300                         rc = llapi_parse_size(optarg, &end,
04301                                               &size_units, 0);
04302                         if (rc) {
04303                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad end offset '%s'\n",
04304                                         argv[0], optarg);
04305                                 return CMD_HELP;
04306                         }
04307                         break;
04308                 case 's':
04309                         size_units = 1;
04310                         rc = llapi_parse_size(optarg, &start,
04311                                               &size_units, 0);
04312                         if (rc) {
04313                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad start offset "
04314                                         "'%s'\n", argv[0], optarg);
04315                                 return CMD_HELP;
04316                         }
04317                         break;
04318                 case 'l':
04319                         size_units = 1;
04320                         rc = llapi_parse_size(optarg, &length,
04321                                               &size_units, 0);
04322                         if (rc) {
04323                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad length '%s'\n",
04324                                         argv[0], optarg);
04325                                 return CMD_HELP;
04326                         }
04327                         break;
04328                 case '?':
04329                         return CMD_HELP;
04330                 default:
04331                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
04332                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
04333                         return CMD_HELP;
04334                 }
04335         }
04336 
04337         if (advice_type == LU_LADVISE_INVALID) {
04338                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please give an advice type\n", argv[0]);
04339                 fprintf(stderr, "Valid types:");
04340                 for (advice_type = 0; advice_type < ARRAY_SIZE(ladvise_names);
04341                      advice_type++) {
04342                         if (ladvise_names[advice_type] == NULL)
04343                                 continue;
04344                         fprintf(stderr, " %s", ladvise_names[advice_type]);
04345                 }
04346                 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
04347                 return CMD_HELP;
04348         }
04349 
04350         if (argc <= optind) {
04351                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please give one or more file names\n",
04352                         argv[0]);
04353                 return CMD_HELP;
04354         }
04355 
04356         if (end != LUSTRE_EOF && length != 0 && end != start + length) {
04357                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: conflicting arguments of -l and -e\n",
04358                         argv[0]);
04359                 return CMD_HELP;
04360         }
04361 
04362         if (end == LUSTRE_EOF && length != 0)
04363                 end = start + length;
04364 
04365         if (end <= start) {
04366                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: range [%llu, %llu] is invalid\n",
04367                         argv[0], start, end);
04368                 return CMD_HELP;
04369         }
04370 
04371         while (optind < argc) {
04372                 int rc2;
04373 
04374                 path = argv[optind++];
04375 
04376                 fd = open(path, O_RDONLY);
04377                 if (fd < 0) {
04378                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot open file '%s': %s\n",
04379                                 argv[0], path, strerror(errno));
04380                         rc2 = -errno;
04381                         goto next;
04382                 }
04383 
04384                 advice.lla_start = start;
04385                 advice.lla_end = end;
04386                 advice.lla_advice = advice_type;
04387                 advice.lla_padding = 0;
04388                 rc2 = llapi_ladvise(fd, flags, 1, &advice);
04389                 close(fd);
04390                 if (rc2 < 0) {
04391                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot give advice '%s' to file "
04392                                 "'%s': %s\n", argv[0],
04393                                 ladvise_names[advice_type],
04394                                 path, strerror(errno));
04395                 }
04396 next:
04397                 if (rc == 0 && rc2 < 0)
04398                         rc = rc2;
04399         }
04400         return rc;
04401 }
04402 
04403 int main(int argc, char **argv)
04404 {
04405         int rc;
04406 
04407         /* Ensure that liblustreapi constructor has run */
04408         if (!liblustreapi_initialized)
04409                 fprintf(stderr, "liblustreapi was not properly initialized\n");
04410 
04411         setlinebuf(stdout);
04412 
04413         Parser_init("lfs > ", cmdlist);
04414 
04415         progname = argv[0]; /* Used in error messages */
04416         if (argc > 1) {
04417                 rc = Parser_execarg(argc - 1, argv + 1, cmdlist);
04418         } else {
04419                 rc = Parser_commands();
04420         }
04421 
04422         return rc < 0 ? -rc : rc;
04423 }

04427 # error "lfs should not depend on lustre_idl.h"
04428 #endif /* _LUSTRE_IDL_H_ */
